title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Roll Sushi Rolls - How To Make Sushi Rolls
content: in this video I'm going to show you how to roll sushi when it comes to rolling sushi there are two schools of thought there is a squared school of thought and the circular school of thought now both are great it doesn't really matter I mean just whatever you prefer to roll is what you should do I like to mix and match because then I do one roll in one way another rolled all the way it adds a bit of diversity on the plate you know I mean you can make beautiful colorful rolls and you could also have them different shapes which makes it quite interesting to look at instead of just having the same plain shape once you decide to go circular or squared the next option is half sheet or full sheet now a full sheet is easier because most people when they try to make a sushi roll they over stuff the roll and then you won't be able to close it now by using a full sheet you can use pretty much as much filling as you want and you'll be more or less guaranteed you should always be able to close it the half a sheet nori sushi roll is what is normally made in most sushi restaurants you simply take a whole sheet of nori and you just fold it in half and then just split and you just use half a sheet of nori I suggest so just this now the reason why this is used in most sushi restaurants is because you're using way less nori let's start with and that saving costs it's quite efficient to roll it you it's pretty fast and what produces a nice square roll okay so now how to do it what I'm doing here is I'm sweating out 150 grams of cooked sushi rice or five ounces of cooked sushi rice over half a sheet of nori now you simply spread it out nice and softly don't overdo it just that's fine it doesn't have to be perfect you just want to get a nice spread over it later when you roll the roll it spreads out the rice more evenly and compress you just add your avocado and well it just doesn't matter the filling so I'm adding here so avocados and salmon and you just simply lift up the back turn it over the filling keeping with your other fingers here the contents in the roll and then turning it over and pushing it in like so then you just turn it over like so and now you firm it up with a bamboo rolling mat now I like to do is turn on one side then firm it up again and turn it back to the original position and firm it up one more time you want to fully cover the sheet of nori and now you want to flip it over you want to place it on top of your bamboo rolling mat with a plastic bag over it now you bring it towards the end here like so you do a little bit of space and you add your filling in this case just some crab sticks and look at the cucumber this is just a show and now you begin the rolling just bring up the back of the mat so you roll it forwards holding in the filling with your fingers and then you press in this way towards yourself applying pressure on the back and filling it up like a square this gives us the square shape by holding the sushi mat in the square shape now you detach push it forward over to the next phase and then just firm up that square face now you do the same to make sure the roll is completely done and that's it and now just apply pressure from the sides and then pressure on the bottle now you do this with both hands and using the index finger to press down and that creates a square draw now rolling it you can roll it either away from yourself or towards yourself I don't really care as long as just roll it now most sushi chefs and restaurants they roll it away from them keeping the incompetence of the roll in with their fingers and rolling over with the thumb okay now I when I started out I used to like rolling it towards me and controlling the content with my thumbs and rolling it up forward this way I could have visual contact with the food as you're rolling it and you could see whatever was going on correct it now the other way you can't you have to curve over and look down underneath and it's not as practical I would say for beginners you probably want to start rolling towards yourself just to get some confidence and when you can flip it over and turn it around and do it get away from yourself now I would say the best method is with a plastic bag around like so it does get a little bit strange sometimes but if you just leave a little gap in a corner so don't completely seal it that allows some air to flow in and out and then you can get the compression or if you could somehow vacuum steal this so you just completely have no air inside so the rolling mat is just tight okay so this is the best method and if your rice still sticks to the plastic what you want to do is just run this under a tub of cold water and even though there is no water on the plastic that you can see there are microscopic particles between the plastic and whatever you place on it so when the rice comes in contact with it it actually doesn't stick to it the key to making sushi and not having the right stick to your hands or anything around you is to have just a little bit of water just before you touch the rice to it so either way cutting it rolling it or touching it with your hands even just to grab some rice you want to always have them slightly damp not wet but just you know a little moist all right the basics of how to roll a simple Maki roll is you just take your rice you spread it out but you leave a little gap about three quarters of an inch long which would be about 1.5 centimeters okay so just simply spread it out and leave an imaginary line here where no rice comes over now you place your filling in this case a little sliver of tuna in the middle of said rice and then you simply bring it over now you can do this you can draw this either by hand or with the help of a rolling mat now in the case of the rolling mat just simply place it over bring the back end of the nori towards the end of the rolling mat and you leave the empty side away from you now you roll it over and you close it so the seaweed paper me to see you paper there's no rice okay and then you simply roll it over okay and there you go and this is how you make a simple squared mac book I think you just find the style of sushi rolling which suits you and just have fun doing it

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll

content: hi everybody welcome to Japanese cooking lovers this is Yuri today I will show you how to roll with all my kids of who Tamaki is DF fat big roll very popular in Japan and this is like a special kind of sushi my mom makes like New Year's Day or sports day like a picnic for our kids school sports day that's the lots of people get together and because it's sushi it's almost like a finger food kind of so it's easy to eat pick up and eat so very popular in Japan of course you can buy in the sushi restaurant sometimes they have pack after Maki sushi and lots of ingredients inside actually more ingredients inside it I think personally tastes better I show you side way and from front way so hopefully you can see what I'm doing how to roll those sushi roll and learn how to do it and it's not that difficult I think so if you can practice a couple times I think you can make it by yourself this is just an example and you can use any ingredients nori has two phases one this is from in China a smoother side and this is backside it's more like the raft side this is the end of the video and I really hope that you learn or actually see what I'm doing it's rolling in to the rice or the sushi inside and keep rolling it is a picnic but I think if you practice a couple times I think you can do it tip is the edge that you have to clean edge of the way you put rice on nori and just keep rolling and practice and you can master how to roll sushi then you can you can eat a sushi in your house this is Japanese cooking lovers and Yuri thank you for watching

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Sushi Rolls | Allrecipes.com
content: sushi rolls are artistic little tubes of deliciousness with a little practice you can make a sushi roll and serve up delightful Japanese dinners or stunning appetizers all sushi rolls have two things in common sushi rice special short grain rice cooked and seasoned it has a sticky consistency that's ideal for making sushi rolls nori dried seaweed that comes in paper-thin squares all the other ingredients are up to you some classic sushi rolls our California roll which has crab cucumber and avocado Philly roll which is made from smoked salmon cream cheese avocado cucumber and cucumber roll with just cucumber a great choice for sushi newbies and kids but you can make a sushi roll using any ingredients and combinations you want generally you'll use one to three ingredients shall we get rolling you need some basic tools bamboo sushi roll mat plastic wrap rice paddle or wooden spoon sushi knife or any sharp knife will do step 1 lay out the mat place the bamboo sushi roll mat on a cutting board position the mat so that the bamboo strips are horizontal to you then place a sheet of plastic wrap on top of the bamboo mat step 2 add the nori place the sheet of nori on top of the plastic wrap step 3 add the sushi rice spread a layer of sushi rice over the nori you'll use about one cup sushi rice is sticky so wet your fingers with a little water to help Pat the rice onto the nori leave a small part of each end of the nori uncovered so you can seal the roll step four add the fish and veggies arrange the ingredients in the middle of the rice don't overpack the sushi roll or it will be too full to roll properly step 5 get rolling bring the bottom of the mat with the plastic wrap up up and over the ingredients press forward to shape the sushi into a tube roll with pressure so you get a firm roll keep rolling until about an inch at the top of the nori shows to help seal it rub a little cold water on the edge of the nori you have a sushi roll to firm up the roll squeeze the mat around the roll until it feels uniform all over don't squeeze too hard you don't want to smash the ingredients together or squeeze them out of the roll ends step 6 cut and serve sushi should be served and eaten immediately so you enjoy the freshness of the ingredients place the roll on a cutting board wet the blade of the knife and slice the sushi roll into small pieces you wet the knife with water and again between each cut to get a clean cut set the cut rolls on end and line up on a serving platter or sushi plates serve with wasabi soy sauce pickled ginger and chopsticks sushi rolls are fun finger food for dinner or appetizers mix and match fresh whole ingredients to make the same rolls you've ordered in restaurants or create your own sushi roll combinations sushi is as creative as it is delicious you

sides off of the bell pepper next I want to lay the freshly cut portion of the red bell pepper face down and I'm gonna cut the bell pepper into slices after that bell pepper has been cut into strips my knife and slice down until I reach the pit once I've hit the pit I'm gonna pick the avocado up I'm gonna point my knife straight up and down I'm gonna very carefully and slowly slide the avocado up the knife but not allowing the tip of the knife to go into the avocado itself next while holding my knife perfectly still I'm gonna rotate my avocado down the knife until it reaches the bottom this is a good way to make sure that you're starting cut lines up with your ending cut I'm going to grab on to the two halves and twist them in opposite directions and then pull them apart next I'm going to set the half of the avocado with the pit still attached onto my cutting board I'm going to very carefully hold on to just enough of the avocado so it doesn't rock back and forth and I'm gonna take my knife and firmly chop it into the pit of the avocado the next time I pick the avocado up again and twist my knife in the opposite direction that I twist the half of the avocado this easily removes the pit next I'm going to take my fingers and without touching the edge of the knife I'm going to place them on the flat part of the blade and then pull straight out to remove the pit from my knife next slices now the key to slicing avocado very thinly is that most people initially want to take their knife and chop straight down in the avocado but you'll notice that the avocado slice sticks to the make sure that you go slow once you're very careful not to cut your hand all right now remove all the eyes from our pineapple we have this fun spiral design going throughout a pineapple and the last sugar into this cup red container and mix that all together until the sugar dissolved and this is what I'm gonna marinate the slices of spam in for about five minutes or so before i grill it okay now that we have all of our ingredients cut and grilled I only get to talk about making hapa rice so hapa rice is supposed to be half brown rice half white rice but brown rice requires twice as much water to cook as sushi rice does so what I had to do was prepare my sushi rice separately for my brown rice after my sushi rice had been seasoned and has cooled down to room temperature and my brown rice content: hey everybody I'm going to show you my experience with my first time making a sushi roll so we're gonna go over the steps and I'm going to show you most of my materials this is a sushi it a lot easier to clean up and it's gonna make it much easier to actually go through the whole process so I'm cutting the other end of the saran wrap and we're going to fold it over so that it sticks to itself and then tuck in our edges and I've seen people use a large ziplock bag I did try that at a later attempt and it didn't work so well for me but it might work for you so definitely don't discount it and now that we're finished wrapping our mat we're just going to go ahead and set that aside okay so some of the other ingredients that we're going to be using are a cutting board and knife we're also going to be using our sushi rice and I'll have the website I used at the bottom some water we're also going to be using mayonnaise mixed with wasabi for a little bit of a kick we have some imitation crab meat and our sushi nori which I bought at the same market as the mat and we're also going to be using some cream cheese okay so we're gonna get started by grabbing our sushi mat and our nori and we're gonna be placing our nori on our sushi rolling mat shiny side down sort of setting that up here and shiny side down the next thing that we're going to do is moist in our hands difficult to roll and your your end result is going to be very thick so the next thing that we're going to do is we're going to be putting on our ingredients and we're gonna start with the wasabi mayonnaise and the reason that I added this was to make sure that it feels kind of moist when you're eating it didn't want just a dry rice roll we're gonna add our cream cheese followed by imitation crabmeat and just break it up with your fingers so that it won't bulk up the roll too much and top it off with some cucumber we're gonna use the mat to lift over the edge and compress the roll and title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make An American Dream Sushi Roll
content: I love sushi I love it so much and after years I've eaten it I decided to teach myself how to make it and now I want to teach you so please enjoy these video tutorials on how to make and here we have the American Dream roll the starter showed the crunchy shrimp tempura along with spicy crab cream cheese and Hass avocado on top start off with the shrimp tempura I buy mine store-bought in the freezer section and heat them up the toaster oven for about 10 or 15 minutes and then you have the creamy Hass avocados to go on top you want to make sure you get a nice ripe one for this and then the cream cheese I use to Philadelphia 30 reduced fat cream cheese and then of course the spicy crab start this roll off I use 2/3 of a sheet of nori now for all my shrimp tempura rolls I use 2/3 of a sheet of nori and it was wet hands take a palm full of such prepared rice and gently press that out to the edge of the seaweed just want to make sure you don't have too much rice on there next we're gonna slice up the cream cheese to add into the roll I always add the cream cheese first this just reduces the amount of mess that you're gonna have if you place it on the bottom and other ingredients on top when you go to roll it up so I just pinch it out make sure it goes to the length of the roll then I add the shrimp tempura now these have been sitting around for a little bit so they're not too hot that's where they melt the cream cheese when you put them in there next I'm gonna add the spicy crab and you're really looking for a nice uniform amount and then the spicy crab is three or four ingredients it depends on your taste mayonnaise sauce sriracha hot sauce and the imitation crab sticks and you see once you take them out of plastic wrap and you peel em they almost become like little strains of spaghetti and you cut them in half Drano make sure you get that excess water out and then I add the mayonnaise and this is for a couple rolls about four rolls five rolls depending on how much you put on there and add the Sorachi hot sauce to taste if you like it hotter add a little bit more so actually hot sauce and then what you're looking for is just a nice consistent amount throughout the entire length of the role that really aids in the presentation and when you go and do that first roll hold it down with your fingers so you get a nice seal and pressing those content: today we're making vegetarian sushi what I've got here is some rice that we've cooked up from the blue a pan recipe some nori some avocado that I sliced up and put a little lime juice on so it doesn't turn brown a little cucumber some pickled ginger black and white sesame seeds and wasabi I've also got a bowl of water and a wet towel I'm going to show you just how simple it is all you do first and foremost is you put your nori down you take some of your rice that's perfectly cooked you want to lay it down in a thin layer over the nori you're going to want your rice to be about two grain thick then very simply can rinse off your fingers and a little bowl of water and get your vegetables in this case the cucumber in the avocado will stick those right in the center of our rice  fingers again wipe our knife so it doesn't get sticky when we cut it put a little bit of water on the edge of the nori just to make it stick roll the nori and the rice and the sushi all up together really tight nice and tight like a cigar squeeze it and roll it and just finish it cut it in half first slice just like that I've got my towel it's got rice on it I'm going to clean it off then we're going to cut it into thirds from there and plate it up and in this case we're going to use a little bit of pickled ginger which is delicious and some wasabi if you like it spicy like me and finally my last little trick we're going to garnish it with a little black and white sesame seeds which are a nice little mixture I just got black ones and white ones mix them together sprinkle them on top dip them in a little soy sauce and go to town enjoy guys

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Maki Sushi Rolls 🍣
content: sushi is any dish that consists of vinegar rice combined with other ingredients such as seafood and vegetables when the sushi rice is wrapped in nori enroled is a sushi roll in Japan it is called Maki sushi or Maki sushi Maki sushi basically means rolled sushi and is usually wrapped in nori but can occasionally be wrapped in soy paper and cucumber there are three main types or sizes of Maki sushi that are inside rolls meaning that the rice is rolled inside the nori thin rolls medium rolls thick rolls then there is an inside-out roll this is a roll which has the rice on the outside and the nori on the inside it may also be sprinkled in Roe or sesame seeds on the outside and last there is the hand roll [Music] you can put different ingredients inside but for the video we'll be making avocado rolls and California rolls [Music] what you will need sushi rice it's important to have the right sushi rice it is specially prepared short grain Japanese rice seasoned with sushi vinegar or vinegar sugar and salt the fillings of your choice [Music] nori sheet for the rolls we need dried seaweed they're roasted and look like thin sheets depending on the type of roll we use half three quarters or a whole sheet of nori bamboo sushi rolling mat start with half a sheet of nori and with its smooth side facing down moisten your hands before you touch sushi rice scoop sushi rice into your hand and place it onto the nori now spread the rice across the nori leaving a half inch to one inch space along the top edge spread the right too evenly add your filling of choice to the middle of the roll this is an avocado roll even we place the filling inside place it onto the bamboo rolling mat roll the sushi over the filling and land right over to the edge of the Rice's you should still see the half inch to one inch nori space after rolling gently shape and tighten the roll with your fingers from outside of the mat with the sushi mat and rotate the roll once to seal the edge of the nori gently squeeze and tighten the roll again with your fingers you can shape the sushi roll square around [Music] with the rough side of half a sheet of nori facing up spread about 150 grams of rice on top make sure the entire sheet is covered with rice flip the nori upside down place the filling on the top side for the California roll its avocado crabmeat and cucumber roll the nori over while keeping the fillings inside you can sprinkle sesame seeds on top if desired firm up the roll with a bamboo rolling mat [Music] to cut a sushi roll wet the knife and cut the roll in half line up the halves and cut into eighth serve with soy sauce wasabi and pickled ginger

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: how to make rainbow sushi rolls
content: how to make rainbow sushi rolls to make a rainbow sushi roll you will need a sheet of seaweed white tuna red tuna crab meat cucumber avocado sushi rice sesame seeds soy sauce ginger and wasabi the tools needed include a sharp sushi knife a bowl of water plastic wrap and two bamboo mats step 1 begin by wetting your hands in order to keep the rice from sticking then using your hands spread the rice evenly on the sheet of seaweed did you know that firm sticky rice is preferred for making sushi because it retains moisture for longer periods it is also important to remember that rice will not stick together after it has been frozen step 2 after spreading the rice evenly on the sheet of seaweed sprinkle sesame seeds on the rice step 3 flip the sheet so you can see the side that is seaweed then place the strip of cucumber and the crab meat horizontally on the center of the sheet of seaweed step 4 roll the roll tightly it will not be perfect so you will need to get the bamboo mat that is covered in plastic wrap press evenly and firmly all the way across applies much pressure as you can so you can get a perfect role then what your hands in order to tidy up the ends of the roll you may have to roll the roll over in order to get it even all the way around step 5 after everything is even lay the tuna across the roll and alternating patterns first the red tuna then the white tuna and keep this pattern going step 6 peel and slice the avocado into thin strips and late each strip between the red and white tuna step 7 after everything is laid across get a sheet of plastic wrap and lay it over the role then get the bamboo mat that isn't covered in plastic and firmly press the roll again step 8 when the roll is nice and round and everything is even begin cutting the role in two halves in order to keep your role rounds make sure the knife is sharp and moist step 10 assemble the pieces onto a platter and prepare to add final touches step 11 once everything is assembled squirt the soy sauce over the pieces and then sprinkle the sesame seeds then add the wasabi and the ginger as you're finishing touches you have made rainbow sushi rolls enjoy

content: see today we're going to learn how to make caterpillar rolls for all your vacatio lovers out there first thing we need is to crab sticks this is for the roll that we're making underneath the avocado and then in the roll as well there's going to be avocados in as well as on top of it so really the base of the caterpillar roll is a mini California roll and that's what we're making first so here with the crab sticks and then with the avocados slice like so and you can slice horizontally if you want for the avocado that goes inside of it but either way remember to put lemon juice on it because you certainly don't want your avocado to turn to brown before you serve the avocado so next we're going to take the cucumber that we already have cut to length and then we're going to cut it into strips so here we're just pulling the knife right down the side like so with especially with a sharp knife cucumbers are very very easy to cut in this fashion so you shouldn't have a problem with that at all and we're going to show you a piece real quick we're going to separate it out and as you can see those are the strip's you're looking for and in particular one that looks like this so once you have the ingredients if we're for the specialty rules we have a mini rice base that you see there and if you don't know how to make that please see the other video with the link up there we explain how to do that it's really simple but please see our how to video now what we're doing here is we're putting together basically our mini California roll to start with you can see we have the crab sticks the cucumber and the avocado and the next thing we do is we're going to go ahead and roll that up and with these mini rolls really you're lucky to get about one and a quarter roll out of it and as you can see here we got one and with the bigger role is usually you can roll it over two or three times with these many rolls you really got to keep it kind of tight and as you can see there that's about and we may have made it close to one and a half time by the firm gripping motion to make sure that everything is coming together on the inside not smashing it but turning into one piece mind you and there we go that's what it's gonna look like and we're gonna take it off our bamboo mat like so and the next thing we need to do is to slice up the other half of that avocado now for this one you do need to cut it in this fashion you can't cut it horizontally for what goes on top and as you can see here the key is consistently sized slices otherwise you get kind of a bumpy caterpillar roll and I know caterpillars are kind of bumpy in nature but usually in sushi you don't want it to look quite like that and once again the lemon juice is essential here especially because the avocado on top is going to be exposed a lot more than the avocado on the inside now we take the avocado pieces that we cut and what we're going to do is we're going to put it on top like so and as you can see some of acardo's are softer than others some are firmer it just depends on exactly where it is in the ripening stage this was just ripe enough to use and right now you can see we're kind of a hard time with it just sitting down on the sushi like we wanted to look like in the end product but don't worry we're going to show you how to do that just a second right now what's key is just to make sure that all of the avocado pieces kind of overlap and that they're all look the same in as far as like the placement so imagine a center line down the sushi and you're balancing all the pieces of the avocado on that center line so they all line up as best you can and probably right about there is enough you want to be sure to cut it from front to the end and the next thing we're going to do is we're going to take a piece of saran wrap and cover the sushi roll like so and kind of make sure it comes down on the edges and then what's the critical step is we take the bamboo mat and we actually squeeze just like so and we want to squeeze firmly enough to make the avocado will be one with the sushi roll underneath not enough to smash the avocado but enough to become one and what's gonna be critical when we cut the sushi up is you want to take a rag and dip it in the right and the water and rice vinegar mix that you had when you made the rice face that we explained in the other video we're gonna use this rag to wipe it make sure it's a clean rag certainly want a clean rag and what we're gonna do is we're gonna use it to wipe the knife between each of the cuts on our roll like so the reason for that is because it makes for nice clean cuts going through the saran wrap and the roll if you don't do that it makes it very very difficult to cut these and you end up getting mess on your hands so right there we're cutting about the width of the avocado pieces on top of the sushi roll we're wetting the knife and cutting right down through it like so and the saran wrap makes this really easy to do and really possible and that's about how many cuts we're going to do now the next step is to pull the saran wrap off like so as you can see the avocado stays like it should and what we do is we take off the pieces and we put it on our display we use a sushi Gator you're welcome to use or whatever you care to at home there we go just like so and there we have it caterpillar rolls and we hope you have as much fun making at home as we did these sure were delicious thanks for watching we appreciate like

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make Sushi Rice for Sushi Rolls
content: hello this is sushi marker today I'm going to show you how to make sushi rice this recipe has come of countless tries making sushi rice and tweaking the recipe and learning as I go so I hope you enjoy this rice recipe it's the foundation of any sushi night please rate and comment and enjoy here we have the ingredients for the sushi rice we have the sugar the rice wine vinegar and the medium grain rice and salt and then we also have my tiger rice cooker it's a recent addition and I love it so far first thing we're going to want to do is measure out the amount of rice we're cooking and it'll be on the back of the package and you're going to want to rinse it with cold water and gently massage the rice and you're gonna have to do several times changing out the water each time and it can take up to four or five times before the water runs clear this is a real important step so you want to take the time to rinse the rice off and get it nice and clean it adds a big difference in the feel and the taste of the rice at the end so once you get that cooked and you get the right amount of water over the rice go ahead put in your rice cooker and set it and basically forget it it'll click when it's done while that's cooking we're going to add the rice wine vinegar you can also get sushi vinegar which will have everything mixed in it right I probably prefer the rice wine vinegar just so you can dictate how much sugar and how much salt you're putting in there for your own personal tastes so you put this in a little small saucepan and the goal is to get it heated up and have it melt into the actual rice wine vinegar so it'll spread over the rice evenly and now our rice is completed it takes about 15-20 minutes depending on the rice cooker and with a tiger rice cooker comes out perfect every time it's beautiful white and fluffy next we're going to add our rice wine vinegar sugar and salt mixture on top of the sushi rice now I normally add this in two stages so you can taste tests in between to see if there's how much more of the mixture you're going to need and ideally you would like to mix it in a large wooden bowl however I don't have a large wooden bowl so I use it in the large glass bowl and I fan it to take the temperature of the rice down not only can you not make sushi with hot rice I tried it it's not fun it you really wanted to have it stopped cooking so it holds that texture I don't add a little bit more of the rice wine and sugar in the salt mixture continue to Fanning it now it's real important when you store it that the rice is at room temperature and you cover it with a damp cloth I made those mistakes before overcook the rice that I didn't cool it off enough and it became mushy and it came really hard when I didn't store a damn cloth over it so be sure to do those two key tips when you're making sushi rice I hope this helps I hope you enjoy the sushi thanks a lot for watching please rate and comment

content: hello everyone thanks for coming to the Japan food channel today this is the great sushi we're going to learn how to make this thing is fantastic and you're going to love it I promise so if you look at it you know it just looks so good and what we do is we start we're using fried shrimp on the inside not tempura shrimp but actually fried shrimp and oh this is really good a little bit of crunchiness in the middle of the roll that you're really going to love and after we put in the shrimp we're going to go ahead and put across our cucumber strips like so and what else we're going to add is cream cheese right in the middle there all this stuff comes together and just has an awesome tasting you're really going to like so once we have that lined up like so we're going to go ahead and roll it up now you notice when we went over if it's a little full be gentle you know work it nice and easy and use the firm but gentle grips to get it all together the cream cheese will give a little bit you don't want to mash everything together but you do want to kind of solidify into that solid tight roll that you're looking for now the next thing we're adding is the eel and the eel is just great you know if you don't know how to work with the EO fillet check out the link there we show you how to cut it and prepare it and it comes with the eel sauce for those you haven't had it it's nice it's sweet oh it just tastes so good and once you get your eel slice up and put on there with you Nagi sauce that's the eel sauce it's a little bit sweet you can kind of see some of it on the plate this roll really comes together that the shrimp Fra so touch have you with the cream cheese but then you got the sweet eel on top and this is great now we put the saran wrap on top then get our bamboo mat and kind of tighten it up a little bit to make sure that that eel on top isn't going anywhere it's going to stay as one piece with that whole roll that's what it should look like then you get your sashimi knife if you don't have one check out our blog amazon tells them for 12 bucks it's a great investment ours is a touch tall but trust me you're not going to regret picking it up it just slices through anything and so what we're going to do here is just cut one half of it to show you how to cut it and then we take it out and we put it on the plate like so and you can see that this thing just really really grabs your attention on the plate and just says eat me eat me this thing is great be sure to try this one at home because you're gonna love it guaranteed thank you for watching we appreciate likes and comments please remember to subscribe and we look forward to seeing you in two weeks thanks

content: thanks for joining us the Japan Food Channel today we're going to learn how to make sweet and fried rolls because they are sweet and there's fried in the middle and it tastes really good first thing we have here is our sushi will rice base and then we have fried shrimp now we've actually sliced in half because they were getting a little too curly on us so if that's what you need to do to get them straight line feel free to do that we can improvise here at the Japan food channel and also we have cucumber slices and then the sweet part of this role at least part of the sweetheart is the unagi eel as most people know it as and this is sweet then we have the fried portion which is the fried shrimp so what we're going to do is you need to be careful when you're doing this because you don't want to over stuff the sushi it gets really tough to roll but when you do have your filling in there go ahead and bring the bamboo mat over and squeeze firmly but gently slowly pulling forward with the saran wrap and just keep repeating the firm but gentle squeezing to go ahead and get this into a tight solid piece now what we're going to do as well is add sesame seeds on top like so you can put them right on and roll you know go ahead and pat them in just a little bit now we have our super sharp shimi knife but if you don't have one click on the link to our blog below we link to our animas on these things are a total steal you really need to get yourself one so starting from the middle we're slicing out about one or two finger widths lengths that it's really up to you whatever your desire for bite size pieces and just work your way out like so then we're going to pull out the pieces the roll and put it on our serving plate and that's what it looks like right there sweet and fried walls are just that they are excellent be sure to try this one at home thank you for watching we appreciate likes and comments please remember to subscribe thank you

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: Futomaki Sushi Roll Recipe - How to Make Sushi
content: welcome back to the video now today I'm going to teach you how to make some sushi a futomaki sushi roll with a little thin sheet of daikon on the outside now what is the photo backing sushi roll well it's a slightly larger sushi roll but it's cut a bit thinner and the daikon sheet I'm going to teach you how to make it in this video but I've also made another video in the past where I teach how to make it a little bit easier with a simpler method you can check that out by clicking in the top right corner your screen well I'll leave a link in the description so you can check out after the video let's get straight to it let's go let's start by making some prep for the recipe for that I'm going to take a daikon radish and just cut it into a block and then I'm going to cut it into a thin sheet this technique is called capsular Mookie and I've made a video showing how to make this a very easy method and the links in the description this is also another great method where you just roll it on the cutting board and zig zag the knife up and down steadily as you push the radish into it once you've got a long enough sheet like this then you just want to cut it and fold it and reserve it for later we'll use that a bit now you take some asparagus and just cut the bottom half off and you just pop these into a cooking pot with some water and salt at 90 degrees Celsius and title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make Sushi Special California Rolls - How to Make Sushi Tutorial 2015
content: today we're gonna learn how to make special California rolls and the first ingredient we're gonna look at is the cucumber you'll see we already have a cut in half and for this one you want to take your knife and make long thin slices as our model is showing and so you start right at the top and if you have a sharp enough knife you should be able to go right through the cucumber straight to the bottom no problem and here we're going to show you an example of how the slice should look and see we made a couple here but that's what you want now next we have an avocado that's been cut in half as well and the same thing you want to slice it lengthwise actually you could go a horizontal as well it really doesn't matter but for our purposes we're going to do it this way and you'll see with a nice sharp knife you can slice right through the avocado just like we did the cucumber and one thing we're going to show you it's a little trick as most of you know avocados tend to turn brown what we do after we slice ours is we add just a little bit of lemon juice to it make sure it keeps its color while it's inside of the sushi now the other ingredient you'll need is the crab sticks and what we do to make it a special California roll is that we slice up the crab sticks into really fine pieces and we're gonna mix it with mayonnaise as will display in just a second I've probably sounds like I'm repeating myself but there really is nothing like a sharp knife when you're making sushi it really really makes all the difference to make sure cuts really clean and nice and makes for making it just a lot more pleasurable experience and here for the crab we use the tataki method that you've probably seen in our spicy tuna roll method as well and really just taking the knife and cutting it as finely as you can it's real important please be sure to be careful when that I have certainly sliced my finger several times while doing this and our model is making it look a lot easier than now yours truly finds it to be so just go back forth over your pile of chopped crap stick to really get it into those fine pieces so it mixes up really well with the mayonnaise that we're going to show in just a moment and back and forth and back and forth and just keep doing that to get the consistency that you like we've made it a bunch of times for our model really knows exactly the consistency we like and it's pretty consistent with what you'll find in the recipes I'm sorry the recipe is I mean the sushi order in the restaurants and you know but each time we have some friends like bigger chunks we like the smaller chunks but hey it's each to their own so that's what you wanted to look like and to mix the mayonnaise you know there's a couple schools of thought we like Japanese mayonnaise when we use it just to dip vegetables in and things like that for us and for what we thought be good for demonstration purposes we use the regular mayonnaise you can find in the store but hey th to the room but essentially this too is whatever consistency you like before the two crab sakes we tend to use one heaping regular spoonful to mix in with it and with this too just like anything else you run and mix it really thoroughly to be sure to get the even consistency all across the board and so we know we keep mixing and that's what you wanted to look like now is the fun part and if you don't know how to make the base to do the Maki sushi or the roll sushi please see our other video we explained how to get it to this point really thoroughly so you can be sure not to make any mistakes and have it exactly how you want it but here we're putting the crab mix just a little bit off-center closer to the model and you'll we explain that the Maki sushi video why you want to do that it helps when you roll it so we take that crab and mayo mixture we just made we apply it evenly all the way across next we're going to do is we're going to take the cucumber slice and notice that the cucumber slice the same length as the makizushi and then we're gonna take those cucumber slices and lay them across like so that way every piece of sushi gets the cucumber crab and avocado mix now when we roll it you want to do it like so look I said it was off-center and you want to put a firm grip on there not enough to really smash everything inside of it but enough to make it definitely come together and form together in one piece and we roll it over again those are nice firm squeezing motions that we just saw again and then we keep doing that once again and this time it took us three times to do it and our models squeezing again nice firm grip and there we go that's what it looks like after it comes out of the roller now here what we want to add as well is the sesame seeds and you'll notice we put our hand there to keep them from flying all over the table even though it's kind of unavoidable we roll it over a little bit add some more to the other side and kind of rub it in just a touch and now the other side the same thing we added just enough to coat it a little bit and now when we cut this is really important because you really need a really really sharp knife now I know there's people who wonder well what's the difference making the rice on the stovetop or in the rice cooker you'll see here we're using rice today that we made on the stovetop and it tastes great don't get me wrong it really does the taste isn't so much of a difference but what really matters is when you cut your sushi you'll see here that it doesn't quite stick together exactly how you'd like now there's nothing wrong with the end product just it's not nearly as clean and pretty as it would be if we use rice cooker rice but that being said the taste is fantastic and you can still make great sushi with it don't get me wrong and here's our final product our special California rolls and take my word for it they tasted awesome for watching

content: I'm going to show you how to make salmon crunchyroll I have salmon here so I'm going to slice for the roll I'm cutting about quarter to half inch thickness of the salmon but what you're looking for is you're going to make a little long sticks so that it fits into the seaweed so I have here the seaweed we're going to use half sea with the seaweed supposed to be shiny side down and the rock side up and the rough side always grab the rice that's why you want to put the rough side up and then rice on the top so now I'm going to do inside out I'm going to spread the rice on the seaweed all over you cover the seaweed with rice each corner and sprinkle sesame seeds you can use a black or white sesame seeds either way where you can mix up and a flip over and I have here crunchy tempura crumb crunchy tempura crumb is when you make the tempura the batter floating on the top they just scrape it up and that's what it is now pick up your bamboo with your thumb with other forefinger hold the ingredients and make sure everything is inside you want it to cover the bamboo with saran wrap otherwise the rice goes in between the bamboo and you're going to have to spend all night long scrape to clean it up so make your life much easier if you have set enough on the bamboo mat and then pick up the end of the bamboo mat and roll and the shape looks like I'm pressing down but not pressing them are just making the shape round to square that's I'm trying to do and if you want you can come the roll to the end and then tuck in tuck in so they're nice and sharp edge on the side now I'm going to show you how to slice so you need a clean knife and you need a wet towel first I'm going to cut in half and when you see the gooey things on the knife you want to clean it up otherwise it's going to keep sticking to your knife yeah this is how you make your crunchy salmon rolls

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Sushi (Maki, California Rolls, etc.)
content: hello my friends today I'm going to be teaching you guys how to make sushi now this isn't exactly the traditional way or even the right way to make sushi but this is what I do every time and I find every time it turns out very well and it tastes very good and for all of you at home who just want to learn how to make sushi a very simple way and not have to go to a sushi bar or a store and pick up very little sushi for a lot of money that doesn't even fill you up this is how to make sushi yourself and as much as you want for not as much as they're charging a store believe me so let's go to the kitchen and see what's cooking okay so here we are in the kitchen and I have all the ingredients laid out as such and the first thing you're going to need of course is rice and a rice cooker but if you don't have a rice cooker you can always just boil water and make some rice in there but nothing beats having a rice cooker I have three myself and I find the smallest one of the law to actually works the best it was only twenty bucks so if you don't have one and you plan on making sushi a lot you should definitely go out and just buy a rice cooker because they're very good and what I've done to this rice is to put a little bit of rice vinegar in it and what this does is it just gives it that little bit of a tangy taste that the sushi has they also have here a powdered rice vinegar and what that does is the same thing but it doesn't make the rice as sticky as the liquid version I do like to use the liquid version however because it does make the rice stick a little bit better to the sheet of seaweed and how you get a way from the knife sticking when the rice becomes too sticky is all you have to do is to get a little cup and you just dip the knife in that and maybe put a little bit of oil in the cup and that will make the knife much easier to go through Bryce when you're trying to cut it and all the ingredients now the ingredients I have laid out tonight you can use all sorts of different ingredients but what I'm going to use today is green onions and also what we have is a pickled radish notice you're going to have some trouble finding unless you go to a world market someplace that sells japanese asian things and also the meat i have here is just some salmon you could get at walmart or any sort of place like that and the reason i'm using this it's just because it's cheaper than buying a whole fish and cutting it out and for purposes of today it worked perfectly and you can also even use imitation crab which is even cheaper so let's get started the first thing you want to do is to cut all the ingredients I don't like to use the head of the great onion just because it gives it too much of an onion taste but some people might like that but I only like to use the soft i think i'm going to show you is the pickled radish which is probably one of the hardest thing to cut just because it has a shape that's not conducive for cutting but it in the end doesn't end up being too much of a problem now of course now we need to spread the rice on the to a seaweed and the rice becomes the most intricate part of this process just because it put too much then the role probably isn't going to close and if you don't put enough then your rice will be overpowered by the amount of ingredients you have and once you're finished with this it's going a little little something like a bit and you want to keep a little bit of an open space on one of the edges right here because that's where your ingredients are going to end up going and what we're going to do now is just to put the ingredients on there now go over here and get the salmon the one throw your ingredients are on there you might want to use a little more than this you can use really any kind of vegetables you want the vegetables complement sushi very well so once you put all these on here all you gotta do is roll it up very slowly so that it is even kind of like rolling a sleeping bag if you've ever done that just keep packing the edges in and because of the liquid vinegar I've used it is very sticky silk it does end up stain very well which actually becomes a problem in our next step which is to cut the sushi roll if you want to serve the sushi at a party or anything like that then you're going to cut it so it can be sort of hors d'oeuvre by putting this oil on to this night that makes it much easier to cut through all of this rice and if you don't do that it definitely tends to stick on there and of course if you're just doing this at home and you just want some sushi to eat then you don't have to worry about cutting this or nearly any of the aesthetic appeal but as we are right now it's all in the presentation so this is what your sushi ends up looking like and I hope now you have a better grasp on how to make very good sushi in a very simple way

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: Mango Avocado Sushi Roll Recipe - How To Make Sushi Rolls
content: in this video I'm going to show you how to make the avocado and mango sushi roll this is a delicious sushi roll where you have crispy salmon glazed in mango juice and slices of paprika then covered with avocado and mango slices in sequence to make just an astonishingly beautiful sushi roll to fry the salmon add a little bit of coconut oil this is a great oil to cook with it's much more healthy than standard oils like olive oil or vegetable oil this is extremely good for you spread the coconut oil around a little bit alright so just add some offcuts of Salman doesn't need to be great power and what you're looking for is to crisp it up make nice crispy salmon that's great just turn over now just break up the common opinion there we go now you add about half cup of mango juice now this is freshly juiced mango and a little bit of honey there we go and just you want to get all the vapors out and slowly the mangoes juice and honey will stop sticking and coat your salmon in a beautiful glaze just keep stirring it around to make sure the sources stick to the bottom of the pan when it starts to lump together that's a really nice sticky layer of sauce and all the concentrated mango flavor is now coating the salmon that's what you really want begin by spreading out five ounces or 150 grams of cooked sushi rice over half a sheet of nori now you want to just spread it out nice and softly and just get a nice even coverage over the sheet with rice get a nice even coverage about teaspoon should do now you want to flip over the rice mat with the nori and place it on a bamboo sushi rolling mat with a plastic bag on it now place a little bit of red peppers a couple slices and then the prepared crispy mango glazed salmon which you just cooked earlier now you've placed the filling of the sushi roll onto it what you do is you bring over the top of the mat and you curl it in and you hold it in with your fingers while you just enclose now here the nori meets the nori and then you simply just move it over and there you go you seal the roll just apply some pressure and then just roll it forward again and apply some more pressure and voila a sushi bar okay now for the topping place thin slices of avocado and mango on top now these were both cut with a cheese knife you can slice it with a knife also but it's so much more easier with cheese knife now just place them on top avocados and mango avocado the mango and etc now I'm placing to avocado and one of mango because the avocado slices were quite small so it just doesn't seem right otherwise we want to get overlap about halfway down the roll this way later you'll be able to cut it off and it'll be a very neat avocado mango pattern okay so once you finish the overlay pattern what you want to do is place some cling film over it and compress the avocado and mango pattern onto it and I'll take the cling film off and what we're going to do for aesthetics is cut the mango and avocado so it has an even straight line they might need to hold some down and then you simply just separate okay there we go and now you have a straight edge line all the way across with avocado and mango okay do the same for title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make Sushi Spicy Tuna Sushi Rolls  - How to Make Sushi RollsSauce 2015
content: now the first thing you needed is a piece of sushi grade fatty tuna and when you go to the meat market be sure to ask for sushi grade seafood that's really important if you don't get that you can really risk making yourself or someone else sick so be sure to double-check with the butcher behind the counter if it is sushi great now our lovely model here is slicing it nice and thin right from the start using our sashimi Hojo and sashimi means basically raw fish and Hojo is the Japanese word for knife that really does make all the difference in the world having a nice sharp knife to work with especially when you're working with excellent cuts of fish like we have today so we slice horizontally or I'm sorry Klee and now we're going back over and trying to get really really small tiny pieces we're going for not quite ground with the hamburger consistency here because there's you know for those of you fans out there from spicy tuna rolls like myself you know we get the really small pieces of fish mixed up with the spicy tuna sauce so that's what we're doing right now is is getting our sashimi grade or sushi grade piece of fish to those little chunks to mix it with the spicy tuna sauce now the Japanese technique here is called tataki and that's what you're witnessing right now I guess chopped is a pretty close translation in English for that it certainly is a little bit different technique but very similar nonetheless and for those of you really interested in Japanese culture and things like that you'll notice that on the hotel our knife if you will there are some engravings on the side and this knife is from Seki and that's where they originally made all of the ninja swords and right now that's a major hub for Japanese cutley as well me and my family visited there that's where they make some very fine surgical knives as well and actually feather brand who makes shaving themes for men his base are as well some excellent knives anything with a blade that comes out of that city is just ridiculously sharp and that's the knife that we're using today as well and I can't stress enough they're having a nice sharp knife working with these kinds of meats really makes all the difference in the world and picture's worth a thousand words so my has been demonstrating the tataki method here certainly be careful with your fingers you don't want to cut yourself and just going back and forth over the meat like so to get it to the almost hamburger consistency is what we're aiming for and I think we're getting pretty close you know just going back and forth back and forth over the meat is really what you need to do so there we are really bunching it together and there we go probably one more pass possibly to to get us there and there we go you see took a couple minutes but that's the consistency you want now that we know that we're at that point one mix in our spicy tuna sauce if you don't know how to make this sauce please see how their video we explained exactly how to mix it together for you guys out there now it gets a little trick you'll notice my is kind of slicing the meat with the spoon to mix in the spicy tuna sauce when you get the meat in this consistency it's not exactly the easiest to mix in sauces with but you just kind of rub it together and mix it around it it does take couple minutes but definitely you want to be gentle with your meat at this point even though we've just chopped it up really really small pieces but you know you don't want to mash it anymore so just be gentle with it mixed around it might take a couple minutes but you can certainly get it to where you want it to be and there's no hard and fast rules on your ratios here it's whatever flavor you want that's how much of the spicy tuna sauce you mix it whatever you think meet your spiciness taste now we also have the avocado slices that we're gonna include well so here we have an avocado that we've already sliced in half and here you can just see with the sharp knife going through the avocado like butter it really is a pleasure to cut with those sharp knives so we were making consistent thin slices from the avocado if you want to slice horizontally instead of vertically that's fine too it really is just personal preference at that point and after we sliced our avocado we want to be sure to add a little bit of lemon on top we don't want our avocados turning brown in the middle of our sushi roll even though it tastes fine it really does get to be rather unappetizing now we're gonna put it on our Maki sushi base if you don't know how to make the base here with the rice in the seaweed please see our Maki sushi video we explain how to do that in depth and really walk you through that process so what we're doing is we're adding the spicy tuna mixture it's hard to tell from the camera angle but it is slightly closer to the chef or our model if you will and you want to extend it all the way to the edges that's really important you don't want to have the orphan sushi pieces on the end that don't have any fish in them so definitely extend it a little bit past the nori or seaweed if you will and that's really really important so after we do that we want to get our avocado slices and they do have the habit of sticking together on the plate what we found after making the videos that really helps is to add some lemon juice between the slices and also on the plate below that helps them slide right off the plate so you'll see how my is adding the avocado slices are slightly lit an angle you don't need to go perfectly horizontal and that's where you want it that's what you want to look like before we go ahead and roll the pieces together now you've grabbed the bamboo mat lift it over enough for it to touch the other side of the sushi and with a firm gripping motion that's how we really get the sushi to come together now you don't want to smash it together you do want to be firm but I definitely don't want to just mash all the gradients in the middle together it really is a fine line that comes over time a little bit of practice and I'm sure you can get it down so we flipped it over again with the firm gripping motion once again and the saran wrap sometimes sticks together but it's not a problem at all and there we go the last round squeeze it a little bit more you'll see some of the spicy tuna coming out the sides if you squeeze it so hard that all of it pops out you definitely know you're gripping too hard but if it does come out just a little bit like so that's perfectly normal and that's what you wanted to look like right there so the next step is to add a little bit of the sesame seeds on the side roasted sesame seeds that is and you'll notice we put it on top enough to coat lightly and Pat it in just to touch now next we put on a cutting board and this is really where the sharp knife pays off incredible dividends you'll notice Sarah it's slicing right through and for those of you who do watch some of our videos I want to point out here that we use the rice cooker for the rice that we used on the spicy roll tuna here and you'll notice that it doesn't clump up as bad when you cut through you'll notice it you get nice clean slices the flavor of the stove type rice comes out the same but with the rice cooker you can see that's where you really get these neat cuts that you can really tell when you're cutting your sushi rolls in particular so here we are you know how thick you want your rolls and things like that is really just up to personal preference it's whatever you like I think we're cutting them a little bit thinner here but that's because we have a family and we all like to have a lot of pieces a lot of different flavored sushi so when you cut it that's what it'll look like and the next step is to put it on the plate for display we use the sushi Gaeta if you want to put on regular plate from your kitchen that's perfectly fine usually it's served with its own wasabi and ginger as we have as well but you take out the pieces for display and there you go there's your spicy tuna roll and we hope they turn out as wonderful in your kitchen as they did arms these tasted fabulous so thanks for watching we appreciate lisen comments and please remember

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make A Bagel Salmon Sushi Roll
content: I love sushi I love it so much and after years of eating it I decided to teach myself how to make it and now I want to teach you so please enjoy these video tutorials on honey today I will show you how to make a bagel roll this is a classic roll with salmon cream cheese and green onions and the star of this roll is of course the salmon I buy this fresh frozen from Catalina offshore products and get it delivered within 24 hours right to your door and here you have the cream cheese that really ties everything together and then of course the chopped green onions that gives it that spicy onion flavor and the top off the roll I use a combination of black sesame seeds and toasted sesame seeds it gives a really nice extra added flavor to the top of the roll so to make this role we start off with the half a sheet of nori seaweed and then a small palm full of sushi prepared rice normally the three ingredient rolls only get about half a sheet of nori and then I'm going to sprinkle on the black sesame seeds now you can mix these up in your own little shaker and then put it on that way I keep mine in their own separate containers they came in next I'm going to put on the toasted sesame seeds and it just adds a nice extra layer of flavor on top and also adds a nice presentation value when you have the black and the toasted sesame seeds in there so we're going to turn that over and the first thing we're going to do is add our stick of cream cheese now I just sliced this off the block it just brings everything together just pinch it so it's about there it'll stretch a little bit and next we add the green onions you're really looking for a uniform coating of green onions you don't want one big bite full of just green onions and then you add two salmon now the key with this salmon is having uniform cuts so the rolls consistent throughout now we're ready to roll it now I hold the filling in with my fingers press it down and then roll it over again to seal it and give it another slight press here just to form it up now to cut the sushi roll I use a wet serrated knife and it's always helpful to have a wet cloth on hand especially when you work with rolls with cream cheese because in between cuts you're going to want to clean the knife off each cut that's the way you get a nice clean cut and this will give you eight pieces of the classic bagel roll salmon and the cream cheese and the green onions it's just excellent roll for any sushi menu thanks for watching this video tutorial enjoy the sushi and rate and comment

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to make Easy and Simple Alaskan Sushi Roll - Video Recipe
content: hi guys today I'm gonna show you how to make Japanese sushi I'm not a sushi making expert but I will show you how to make fast and easy homemade recipe today I will be making Alaskan roll basically it is fresh salmon avocado and cucumber you can make any kind of sushi rolls with any kind of fillings I will put in the description box below what kind of sushi rolls you can make and what kind of feelings you can use so let's get started to make sushi you will need a bamboo sushi rolling mat you can buy that at any Asian market to make the rolling mat last longer you will need to wrap it in a cling wrap to do that place a long piece of cling wrap on a working surface place the rolling mat on top leaving out about an inch of cling wrap on each side place a little piece of double tape on edge of the rolling mat to secure it in place now cover the rolling mat with the other half of the cling wrap press down a little bit or the tape is now flip the rolling mat to the uneven side and roll up the edges we will be working with the flat side of the rolling mat then we will need 1 cup of sushi rice 1 tablespoon of rice vinegar 1 avocado one long cucumber half a pound of fresh sushi grade salmon make sure to get sushi grade salmon for safety slice all of that and do thin even strips six sushi nori sheets first we will need to cook the rice to do that bring two cups of water to boil when the water starts boiling at half a tablespoon of salt and rice and bring it back to a boil when the water starts boiling again turn the heat to low cover with lid and cook for 20 minutes when the rice is done cooking add 1 tablespoon of rice vinegar and mix in well take a large plate with high borders add the rice on top and with a wooden spoon start spreading the rice around the bottom it's best to do this on a round wooden plate but I don't have it so I use this baking pan when you're done mixing and spreading the rice around the pan cover it with the tin foil to keep it warm please serve all in Matt with the folded edge of a cling wrap facing you take one sheet of nori and place with the glossy side to the bottom place the bottom edge of nori exactly to the bottom of the rolling mat place about three tablespoons of rice on top of nori and spread it evenly on top of the sheet when you get to the top leave about an inch of nori without the rice now place two slices of Salman on top then cucumber and avocado now pick up the bottom of the rolling mat hold down the filling and roll up the sushi now pick up the rolling mat and keep rolling the sushi now when you get to the edge with no rice on it dip your index finger and water and slide through the edge now finish rolling your sushi roll when you're done rolling all the sushi now it's time to cut it take your sharpest knife dip the tip of the knife into the water and slide the drop through the edge of the knife and now cut the sushi in the middle event two times on both sides and that's it serve your sushi with pickled ginger wasabi or soy sauce if you want thanks for watching and enjoy

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Easy Sushi Rolls with Shrimp and Avocado
content: hi everyone I'm just doing a real quick impromptu live broadcast tonight I wanted to show you how I make my super super simple sushi rolls at home and for those of you that aren't crazy about preparing food raw at home I'm going to show you how to do it with some steamed shrimp and avocado what you'll want to do is want to turn that down from in more more MORE okay thank you what you're gonna want to do is cook your sushi rice to package instructions and add your seasoned rice vinegar to make a sticky rice and then I took some shrimp and steamed it in some organic vegetable broth until it was cooked and later I will show you how to peel them I always like to buy them with the skin still on or shell still on because it's either cheaper or just seems less processed to me and then I also sliced some avocados and squeeze some lime juice on them so they don't turn brown and you're also going to need some sushi sushi nori which is the dried seaweed wrappers and we're going to be using a bamboo mat for rolling it so let's get started first I want to peel my shrimp and if you've had peel-and-eat shrimp before in a restaurant you certainly know how to do this already but you want to take everything including the tail off if you're making cook sushi at home you could do all sorts of different flavors sometimes I do sometimes I do teriyaki salmon and really thinly sliced cucumber for texture we've also done oh gosh what else have we done we've even done guacamole and a garlic shrimp inside yes and one time Marlin even we followed a facebook video and found a sushi recipe that had flaming hot cheetos inside and although it wasn't my favorite flavor for sushi it did add a great crunch and Marlon thought they were great okay so that's enough for us to get started here what I'm gonna do is cut them right down the center so they're a little flatter for inside our rolls then they're about the same thickness as my sliced avocado I think it was easier to go from this side we've been making sushi at home for a couple of years now still like to go to sushi restaurants especially for the raw food sometimes I prefer to have someone professional preparing it although I have found an amazing fish store our fish market here locally that serves that sells ahi tuna from Hawaii and they fly it in overnight every day so that's pretty amazing Marlin and I have even done a little trick where we'll close our eyes and bring the fish closer to each other's nose and say okay when you smell it when you know I'm close let me know when you smell it and it gets so close to us that you can actually touch your nose and still not smell it it's that fresh I think that's just absolutely amazing so anyways we've got all of our ingredients ready now and so I'm going to get started with my first sushi roll so you're gonna lay the mat out add one of our sushi wrappers our seaweed wrappers and then to get the rice on there it's really helpful to have a little ball of water so that your hands are wet it keeps the rice from sticking to your fingers as you're putting it down on the roll you can use a spoon or one of those bamboo little paddles that comes in a kit if you buy your bamboo mat within a kit it often comes with that a little paddle okay that's pretty good so now I'll put in some avocado and shrimp get my hands a quick quick rinse okay and then we're going to take this and wrap it around if you want to start rolling and make sure that you get your seaweed at least over the filling inside so we're going to start by pushing there and then you might give it a little press down you know I'm not claiming to be a sushi chef but I just think this is a great way to make an interesting meal at home that is really not very difficult at all try that again and you just want to keep rolling and pressing you want to put the seam side down for cutting okay so you've got this you start by cutting in the center and then we'll cut slices from there you'd serve this with some soy sauce with some wasabi pickled ginger chopsticks even a side salad if you felt like it and that's how quick and easy it is to make homemade sushi rolls at home hope you enjoyed it if you have any questions by all means feel free to ask and I will talk to you later bye

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make Sushi - Shrimp Tempura Rolls
content: today we're going to learn how to make shrimp tempura rolls now the first thing you need a shrimp tempura and if you don't know how to do that please see our other video we explained in depth how to make shrimp tempura to make great rolls now when you do that you want to make sure you have your shrimp tempura as I said and the first piece you want the tail to stick out at the end and on another note if you don't know how to make the Maki sushi for the rolls the base there for the sushi rolls please see our other video because we explain how to do that as well now you'll notice that our lovely model is pulling the tails off the shrimp you definitely want to do that for the pieces that are going to be in the middle so you remove the tails from the pieces that will be in the middle and the two shrimp on the ends you want those to have the tail stick out I you know you do the occasional person who likes to eat the tail but that's what you want to do is have the ones on the end stick out and the ones in the middle pulled off and the key ingredient for your flavor here is the unagi sauce unagi means eel and Japanese so it's really eel sauce and for those of you don't know don't worry it doesn't taste like eel it's actually a really sweet sauce so just a little bit goes a long way we just want to add a hint of that flavor now once we get to that point we want to go ahead and start rolling up the sushi so as you can see we pull the bamboo mat up and over and firmly squeeze the sushi roll at all portions not to really pulverize the shrimp but really to get it to be one solid piece there you go there's the firm gripping motion notice it's firm not not an overkill you really don't want to smash your shrimp here so there we go one more time to really complete the roll all the way across and get all the rice to stick together and that's what you're going to want it to look like right there there you go now we're going to put it on a cutting board and here's what we're going to apply our toasted sesame seeds and these really add that little extra hint of flavor that's really good and after that we're going to cut our sushi and we really really advocate using a sharp knife as possible for this it really helps with the rice and the stickiness and there you go that's how you want to cut it basically pick the center point and work from there there we go so really this is going probably one of the smoothest if any of you have tried to cut roles with knifes that aren't sharp you know it can be quite difficult and really sometimes you get a mess but but sometimes you have nice clean cuts so after you've cut your sushi you want to go ahead and put it out on your display plate or your serving plate we're using a sushi Gator plate and in the case of shrimp tempura not only do we put the Nagi sauce on the inside we also want to put a touch of it on the outside too now too much just enough for some light decoration and a little bit of flavor and that should just about do it here's what our final product looks like and trust me it was absolutely delicious this is a real good recipe for you guys to use out there so thanks for watching we appreciate likes and comments please

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Sushi
content: how to make sushi you may think sushi is just raw fish but you'd only be half right it's actually the combination of fish and rice and how its combined is an art form in itself you will need at least a quarter pound of trimmed uncooked saltwater fish such as wild king salmon yellowtail or bluefin tuna a sharp knife a cutting board a dollop of prepared wasabi a bowl of water 2 cups of prepared sushi rice a serving plate or board soy sauce a small dish and some Japanese pickled ginger optional some ice or a refrigerator step 1 with a very sharp knife slice the trimmed fish slab into individual portions so each piece is a rectangle approximately 2 inches long and a quarter inch thick to make things easier cut all your fish at one time but keep the pieces cold until you use them put them on a plate and keep it in the refrigerator or on top of some ice step 2 moisten your hands with water from your bowl and scoop an ounce of sushi rice about the amount that will fit into your palm and roll it into a ball step 3 shape the rice ball into an oblong by squeezing it with firm but gentle pressure your rice should be about the same size as your cut piece of fish step 4 pick up a piece of sliced fish while palming the shaped rice scoop up a tiny amount of wasabi with your index finger and gently dab it onto the middle of the fish step 5 press the shaped rice against the fish and gently but firmly cut the two together until they adhere step 6 firmly squeeze the sushi together until the fish and rice become one tap with your right index finger as you go to create a uniform shape step 7 place the finished sushi on a serving plate or sushi board and continue making pieces until all the fish is used step 8 garnish the plate with a mound of Japanese pickled ginger and a smaller mound of wasabi pour some soy sauce into a small dish and get ready to dunk did you know real wasabi is notoriously expensive so most sushi restaurants just use a mixture of horseradish mustard powders and food coloring
