you could be really creative with you can make it into anything really so good my sushi rice already but for the three cups that I use they seasoned it with half a cup of rice vinegar 2 tablespoons of sugar and half a teaspoon of salt I cooked that I actually cooked it on high up until it boiled for about five minutes and then I cooked it for another 20 minutes but I made sure it that I was on a like about low medium and then I turned it off and just kind of let the rice sit until it absorbs all the water you want to check up on the race that it's just nice and soft but not mushy you can use scallions for this that I'm using chives I mean our mince my smoked salmon you can use two enough for this make sure if you use two Nets a sashimi grade or sushi grade which means that it's been um gone through a process of freezing process to kill the germs but because I'm using a smoked salmon it looks like it's raw but it's actually not and you want to finely dice this when you get sushi or like a dragon roll that has that spicy tuna they tend to be very mushy I don't like that so I'm dicing it but if you like it to be more processed just put it in a blender as far as the spiciness goes I usually use about a tablespoon of sriracha and about another tablespoon of chili garlic sauce now I'm going to be adding my sesame seed oil about a tablespoon of that and some rice wine vinegar and about another tablespoon of it I'm gonna mix all these ingredients together and then throwing those chives in the salmon I've cut my cucumber vertically because it's longer that way and it's easier for it to roll down the sushi now if you don't like the seats you can remove that but I don't mind so I'm gonna keep those here I'm covering my bamboo mat with some saran wrap so the sushi doesn't going to add our rice that has been cooled down to my nori seaweed sheet and you want to add rice almost all the way you want to leave a little gap so it makes it easier for rolling I start setting my cucumber down now we left a little gap because I'll make it a little easier for it to roll out so you're going to roll it and then tighten this and you open it back again and you keep rolling this out with saran wrap just to make it a little bit easier for me to actually touch the avocado and start rounding it out a little bit so start pressing and then you could use your sushi mount and help it a little now we're going to cut it into pieces I keeping the saran wrap on there it also makes it a little easier so for my dragon I've added some black sesame seeds some jalapenos cucumbers that tongue is actually red bell pepper that I've shaped the eyes are made out of mayo sauce topped with some sesame seeds and then I tucked the entire thing with sriracha and some mayo sauce so get creative and I'll see you in the next video thank you

content: welcome back 11 video I'm chef Devaux and today we're going to do a very special Halloween inspired sushi roll with black sushi rice and dehydrated carrier on the outside it's a very special new concept I hope you guys enjoy it and don't be freaked out with my eyes let's go okay so let's get going what you're gonna need is a carrot and then what you want to do is just clean it and for this I'm just gonna take a knife and just smooth the cut off the skin of the carrot now you don't have to do it this way I just like to do it this way and you like to use my beautiful knives but you can just use a normal peeler to peel off the skin no problems there okay so just gonna quickly peel this off and there I love using the knife like this in this way I just love using my knife is just it's a pleasure to work with these in the kitchen and that's I think what's all about when you buy some ways what I'm talking about this knife if you guys want to buy it you can check it out on my website if you're in Europe by clicking on table when screen if you know in Europe then click underneath it to go to my website to check out the knives in America and so that okay so I'm just going to cut off the edges and then discard all this excess and now I'm just going to use a microplane or you can use a cheese grater or something else great assist students livers of characters they're great just watch out for your fingers not to scrape the fingers away because that can really happen just at the end don't bother game the last outfit just eat the pics of Trumpets at this pretty little anyway okay so once you're done you take the grated carrot and you spread it around on one of these levels of the dehydrator now what you want to do is just spread it out very nice and thinly and you want to fill up all the trays and just fill it up if you want one of these you can check it out by clicking on the top left corner screech they're pretty cheap to buy and they're pretty cool to put stuff in tonight okay so what's going to happen is it's going to blow hot air through it and over the course of a day it's get a dehydrator to crispy character so here we go it's been overnight and I'm just going to turn it off and then this is the crispy outcome of the carrot it's really crunchy crispy amazing texture it's just great it's like carrot chips and you can make carrot chips if you just you cheese knife instead and create thin strips now what you want to do is you want to take these and put them away from humidity so we're gonna put them inside an airtight up like this and just pack it in there completely and seal it up and it's very important to keep away any humidity because the slightest bit of dampness and these characters become soggy so you really don't want them and then you can store this away for quite a while just the longer you store it it does become a little bit oxidized so you just try to use as fast as possible ok so now for the rice what you want to make is black water and this is basically just squid ink and water and what I'm using is about five to six grams of squid ink for every hundred milliliters of water and I'm adding this water into the sushi rice so here I'm just going to add the squid ink you can buy this usually by the fish mongers and if you just ask someone will know somewhere close to you in the supermarket a place to buy it alright so what you want to do is just blend the squid ink with the water and this we just infused together you just whisk it you seem to get new lumps of twinning going in the water you don't want that you've got just be one uniform liquid okay so now he's gonna add this water to my sushi rice just like you would normally I've watched this sushi rice already and now he's gonna cook inside the rice cooker now if you don't know how to make sushi rice check out the sushi rice recipe by clicking on top left where sweet and you go to my website where you'll see my recipe now just this is the highlight I'm not showing you the quantities or anything I'll just go to the website there on top left corner to figure that out but look at this right it's now deep black color it's just it's an awesome change from what you always have the sushi rice which I find very interesting ok so now just like normal I'm just gonna season it with the sushi rice vinegar mix just lightly drizzle it over and then just spread it among inside your handiwork ok and now to use the rice take half a sheet of nori paste on a cutting board and then paste 120 around the sushi rice and that's about 4 ounces and spread it out nice and softly and quickly and just don't press it down too much okay a tip here use wet hand slightly damp so the rice is sticky hands much now put bamboo rolling mat inside a plastic bag and flip it over so the rice is now underneath and the noir is on top and now you take a beautiful piece of sashimi grade salmon you can check out what the sushi grade salmon is by clicking on the top left menu screen and just roll it over this you want to close it before it reaches the end and then just seal it now and then roll it over one more time just to shape it and press again okay there we go that's a sushi roll done and now to cut it I'm just gonna move it slightly take my knife and just wipe it on a damp cloth so the rice doesn't stick to it much and then just slice it in half and then wipe it again keep wiping in between cuts and you're going to cut the halves into quarters now and the quarters into eighths and now the other quarter into 1/8 and I'm going to go back to the other half and cut that into quarters again and then those quarters into eighths so here we've got eight pieces of sushi now I'm just gonna reshape it again just the case it's just any rice might go out of shape perfect and now I'm going to remove the side piece because I find the bit not that beautiful so just remove them you can eat them just I don't like to take them but it's now I'm just gonna add my crispy carrot which we make earlier on top of the sushi roll now the reason why I'm adding this is the end after cutting and not before because this stuff becomes soggy so fast I guess that before so if you put it on before and then you cut it and then you press it into the sushi roll what happens is it just becomes a soggy mess and it's just not what I'm looking for so by adding this after I cut it it remains crunchy and crispy and it's just it's an experience it's something special right so again I'm just gonna put some more on the top be generous with and cover it all the way around the sushi roll Peters be careful to keep all the pieces together so you don't get crispy carriage stuck on the sound and only on the outside of the sushi roll get a nice beautiful cover and put some more on top okay nearly done there we go okay just put this to one side take a plate to plate up beautiful Japanese plate okay and now he's going to take a sushi roll piece and place it onto the plate like this there we go make another one put it behind and that you guys can plate up obviously with the entire roll but I'm going to show you to now put a little bit of pickled ginger and a little bit of fresh wasabi there we go this is the Halloween sushi roll done okay so this is the end of the video I hope you enjoyed it and if you found this video useful then don't forget to hit the like button down there or share this on Facebook Google+ or Twitter whatever you use now if you have not sure of a subscribe to my channel by taking on top left corner screen and check out all my other videos that have made which are a lot now by clicking on the right last but not least last year I made a sushi ball inspired by Halloween video with new rice balls and there were orange with salmon and nori to make your pumpkin faces you can check that out by clicking on the left right now thanks for watching see you guys next week

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make a Dog Sushi Roll  - Food Art
content: welcome back to lurking video today I'm going to show you a very interesting arty sushi roll with a dog picture the inside made of fish and rice so when you cut it in half you'll see the dog in your sushi it's a very interesting thing to do let's get going just cook it alright start off by taking a baby cucumber and a mandolin and set it to two millimeter thickness so you get extremely thin slices of cucumber and firmly press it down and slice it across the blade just like so now you want to have very very thin slices so they extremely flexible okay so here we go now I've got my slices I'm just going to take one of these nice flexible slices lay down on the cutting board and cut off the edges so you have a slice of cucumber about two centimetres wide which is 4/5 of an inch there we go and I'm going to take half sheet of nori which is conveniently about the same width as the cucumber and just slice a piece off that's long enough to just wrap around the cucumber once there we go once you've wrapped it down you just want to place a book on it or something to compress it down so it adheres to the nori and again I'm just going to take another slice and this time going to cut a half a centimeter thick slice so that's 1/5 of an inch just like this and dispose of the rest and again just take a piece of nori and cut it just wide enough so it can wrap around the cucumber once so here I'm just going to put the cucumber and roll it round so that I can just cover it with this okay and again just place it underneath the book so they can properly adhere and compress to it there we go alright so this is the two slices the thin one and the thick one and this will do look like more that's when they compress all right I'm going to taking sushi rice a little bit at a lot and add some black and blue and mix it and there we go dueces you race okay now I'm going to take a thin strip of nori about two and a half centimeters one inch and I'm going to add about ten grams of black sushi rice I'm going to put it lengthwise across the noise just like so and then I'm going to roll this into a simple roll and this will make the nose of the dog later so once you've done that and made it perfect just put that to one side until your knees now I'm going to take the thick piece of cucumber that I'm a just a second ago and add a little bit of rice on top about four to six grams of sushi rice and then I'm just going to curve this into a C shape and the rice helps keep it in that C shape and the reason for this is so it can make the mouth of the dog with a little slight curve to it alright so once you've done that just put this to one side until you need it later okay great now I'm going to take the thin slice of cucumber and do the same but this time with much much less rice I'm just going to take a single grain at a time and place them in a single file just like so and then again just curve this up into a C shape so that it can also be slightly curved and once that's done then just put this to one side until it's needed later and I'm going to take half sheet of nori and a quarter sheet of nori and join them together using some rice glue just place the rice on one of the sides just like this and then just cover it with the other sheet and then press down and this will make one long sheet of nori just like this now you take your rolling mat and just place it down and place your nori on top and they take a hundred grams of cooked and seasoned sushi rice and just start spreading it from one side going towards the other side and it should cover about three-quarters of your sheet just softly spread it out nice and gently now it's very important that this segment here is a little bit less rice because that will make the earlobe a donee damaged rice so take a little bit from there and to the other end okay now I'm going to take my salmon and just place it down on the edge and then just roll it over just like so until three of the four sides of the salmon are covered with Reisman order and I'm going to take some rice and place it on the fourth side just like this now this you want to do - I there's no set amount just where you feel it right and this will make the top of the head of the dog once you've done that just roll it over on top of the rice and then just bring it to the side of your mat and press it against it then take a hand towel and just press it against that so it keeps in place while you're working just like so now I'm going to take a little bit more rice and just press it into corner just like this again just do it with your better judgement of what you feel is right for this section and then you want to put the eye part of the cucumber so the thin strip and place it with the rice facing upwards just like so then you want to cover that in some more sushi rice just like this again just use your better judgement for what you think is right here now you take your thick piece of cucumber with rice facing down and you just want to put it at a 45 degree angle just so it is pointing towards the eye pot and now you just want to fill in the gap between the earlobe and the mouth just like so making sure not to cover the leading edge of the mouth there okay I think this is just right and now I'm going to add just a little bit more rice just here just to give it a little bit more body and here I'm just going to start rolling just bring it towards the ear and then press it down okay great now I'm just going to flip this thing over and compress it like you would a sushi roll just so it becomes one piece great now I'm going to create indentation here which would be the classic curvature of the dog face okay so just use your matter compress it down great and now I'm just going to tuck in the edges because the rice coming out a little bit so I'm just going to put them out over it and tuck it in and then do to the other side just tuck it in maybe better to use them up and then tuck in okay and now again I'm just going to work on that annotation just press it down with your fingers or you can better use the rolling mat to press it down in a single weight just like this okay great now you've got a beautiful curve there and that's just what I'm looking for all right now I'm just going to add a little bit of blue sushi right so later when I roll it that indentation stays in place so you just add what you believe is right there again perfect okay so take two half sheets of nori which are being glued together again like I did before and you want to take some blue sushi rice and just start covering it from one side start off by covering about half of this long sheet and then you'll stop and see where you're exactly at and maybe a little bit more of sushi rice data okay I'm just going to place the dog face down so I can judge how much more rice to put and I'm just going to add that black sushi rice roll we made before there is a nose at the front end of the dog face just like this and make sure there's no gap so press it up against it just like so and just roll it up and here now to check how far the blue sushi rice goes if I need any more now I can see here I need a little bit more just to make it round so I'm just going to take some more blue sushi rice and just fill in this section here correct I think this is just perfect okay so now I'm going to roll this forwards okay great and now I'm just going to roll it like I would a sushi roll again just make it one piece is now that I've compressed it I'm just going to tuck in the sides of the sushi rice again just make a little pretty tuck in this side and tuck in the other side and now to cut the roll I'm going to take my extremely sharp knife and slightly wet it so it goes through the rice easier and just slice through the roll like this and it reveals this beautiful little sushi roll dot and now you can just cut a slice off now it will typically yield about four pieces of sushi and they all look like this dog so there we go this is the end of the video I hope you enjoyed it now you know how to make a dog sushi roll which is a great skill to know in life so one last thing if you like this sushi t-shirt with this sushi hugging itself then check out the link in the top left for your screen or in the description below for where you can get yours you can also get it in different colors which is really cool thanks for watching see you guys next week goodbye

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Spicy California Rolls : Sushi Preparations
content: hi my name is chef sid marshall and this is how to make a spicy California roll a basic California roll is crab cucumber avocado with nori and rice to make it spicy we're going to add Korean red chili paste known as sriracha to our crab mixture sriracha can be very spicy so start by adding just a little bit at a time to your crab mixture till you get it to the spice level you are looking for the next step in making your sushi is putting the rice onto the nori you want to cover the entire sheet of nori with rice for an inside-out roll once we put the rice on we're going to turn the nori over to put in our ingredients you can use just about anything you'd like a typical California roll would be crab cucumber and avocado starting at one end slowly start folding your nori over the top of your ingredients continuing all the way down and doing a gentle roll until you have enclosed the nori with the rice using your Maki soo then you can shape your roll before cutting it once you have your roll made you want to start by cutting it right down the middle then bring the two pieces together and cut down the middle again cutting those pieces in half and the other side in half until you have eight pieces and there you have it how to make a spicy California roll

a spicy California roll

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make Seafood Dynamite for Sushi Rolls
content: I love sushi I love it so much and after years I've eaten it I decided to teach myself how to make it and now I want to teach you so please enjoy these video tutorials on how to make western-style sushi please rate and comment today I'm going to show you how to make seafood dynamite it's great inside the roll on top of the roll you can also put it on top and bake it in the toaster oven for a seafood dynamite so here's a list of ingredients and we're gonna start off with the fish cakes or the imitation crab sticks these come individually wrapped and then here I have some bay scallops I buy frozen in my local grocery store and just saw them out and seam them up in my bamboo steamer for about 2 or 3 minutes and then I have cooked salad shrimp you can also use thawed out peeled deveined and tail off shrimp and here we have masago or the small orange fish eggs they add a really nice flavor and little complexity to the seafood dynamite so the first thing I'm going to do is take my stack of fish cakes and get some of that excess moisture that's trapped inside there you don't want that in your seafood dynamite sufficient when you're rolling it out so I cut them in half sometimes I'll cut them in thirds it just depends on how big are the strands you want the crab sticks to break down into so then you just break them up and you see they become very stringy and here we have the bass scallops that I steamed up in my bamboo steamer and I'm just gonna give him a rough chop I like you know biting in there getting a big chunk of scallop are you gonna add those to the rest of the mixture which so far is just a crab stick broken up and now we have the steamed scallops here my thawed out salad shrimp like I said before you can use whole shrimp you steamed up rock shrimp any shrimp you really had on hand at different variations I think would give this a little bit different flavor and taste profile and we're going to add those to the mixture as well and I give those a nice rough chop as well so I like everything to they have a nice rough chop so you get a taste of the different ingredients in there and next I'm gonna add a couple tablespoons of mayonnaise I use Hellmann's you can use a Japanese mayonnaise which is a little sweeter I always happen to have it on hand and then Sriracha hot sauce of course and just thoroughly incorporate the ingredients you can always add more so at this point let work it in there and get a feel for the consistency next I add the masago which are the small orange fish eggs you can skip this step if you're not a fan I think it adds a great flavor and if I have them I always add them in there I absolutely love them and next we just want to gently mix in the masago into the mixture and here you have this seafood dynamite to finish this off I'll place a plastic wrap on top and press it down on to the mixture and then I stick it into the fridge for about 15 minutes to let it set up thanks for watching my video tutorial on how to make seafood dynamite please rate and comment and enjoy the sushi

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To Make A Spicy Crab Sushi Roll
content: I love sushi I love it so much and after years of eating it I decided to teach myself how to make it and now I want to teach you so please enjoy these video tutorials on how to make and here we have the simple spicy crab roll that's a hit at any sushi night and for the ingredients we start off with the spicy crab you can add masago or not it depends on your tastes and here we have the ingredients we have the fish cakes or the imitation crab you can use Hellmann's or the Japanese mayonnaise and then the Sriracha hot sauce and then here we have the masago like I said I'm a big fan of this so I always add it in there five extra and on top we're going to add some toasted sesame seeds and some black sesame seeds to give it a nice presentation and a little added flavor on top start this roll off with a half a sheet of nori toasted seaweed and a small palm full of sushi prepared rice and with wet hands you're going to want to gently press the rice out to the edge of the seaweed and I'm going to sprinkle a layer of the toasted sesame seeds now you can really overdo it with these so just be careful on how much you put on there and on the black sesame seeds I recently started using I don't think they have much of a flavor but they do add a wonderful presentation value to the roll when it's all said and done and I do this while it's flat so the whole roll has the sesame seeds on it [Music] and then what you're looking for is a nice uniform amount be careful not to overfill your roll because you'll have a hard time sealing it so I hold the filling in with my fingers and then do the initial pressing of the roll this will compact the filling and give you a nice lip for it to seal when you're doing this you want to make sure that there's not a bunch of water on that seal part of the roll so you get a nice seal otherwise if you have a bunch of crab in there won't seal the roll and it'll be a mess when you go to cut it and one more time to form it up and with the wet serrated knife I cut the roll in half line those halves up cut those in half again and cut each of those in half you want to make sure to wipe your knife off in between the cuts and here you have the super simple but tasty spicy crab roll I hope you enjoyed this video tutorial on how to make american-style sushi rolls please rate and comment and enjoy the sushi [Music]

content: oh hi guys this is me again and this is some like it hot I just came back from a really long day so I think I'm gonna make some Maki rolls with some vegetables since like i'm in india i cannot find all the ingredients but i'm trying to find out something so just give me a second i will leave my bag and I will see in the kitchen are you ready to roll some maki rolls first I need this bamboo stick board that will call it like this you can buy from every international store market it calls like hundred rupees not more then this is a seaweed made like this and it's called nori this we will use for base so i have three four five it depends how much you want to make then here i already prepared a bowl of Japanese rice which is which is specified only to make my kyros which is some like normal white rice but it's quite sticky so if you are doing one cup of rice you have to put two cups of water leave it to make it cold and after that like you see it's quite sticky because I will need this to roll so let's make this thing I'm taking the nori i will put some rice vinegar on it to make it much more softer then a spoon of the rice so I'm spreading the rice on the nori then in the center put some vegetables I already chopped the vegetables on the like this I'm going to put a cucumber if you want you can add avocado too into it whatever vegetables you like but mainly how Japanese people are making it they put cucumber avocado and that's it I have the kini I have some mango now I'm going to turn it and start rowing and I'm going to press it a bit can't you see then turn again now you need a sharp knife to cut it well I will put on the top of the rose some sesame seed or you can also put them inside when you're rolling them try them like this so hope you enjoyed please subscribe to my channel like I will be waiting for your comments your feedback so whatever that's it I was dead sea and this is some like it hot

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: HOW TO MAKE ROLLED SUSHI - Sushi Recipe - 巻き寿司 and 裏巻
content: hi and a huge welcome to steve's kitchen earlier in the week we made the sushi rice the perfect sushi rice and then i went on to use that to make an onigiri well it seemed a natural progression that we make the rolled sushi nick so i'm going to show you today how to make a very simply the rolled sushi and i'm going to do the inside out style and the outside in if there is such a thing now if you haven't made the rice already i'll leave that link just here and we're going to take it from that stage where the rice has come off the stove and now we're going to make that vinegar with a little sweetness in it to pour over the rice to make our sweet in vinegar we start with half a cup of rice vinegar Japanese rice vinegar and into that I'm putting quarter of a cup of white sugar and about a teaspoon of salt now we're just going to take that over to the stove and warm it gently not to heat it vigorously just until the salt and the sugar has dissolved so we're not looking to boil the vinegar we're just looking for the last grains of salt and sugar to dissolve and get a nice clear liquid again and that is what we're looking for so I'll just set that aside now and use it with our prepared rice now have my perfectly cooked rice here and before when I made the onigiri I poured the rice onto a wooden board now the Japanese have these beautiful wooden bowls and I haven't got one of those but you must use either a wooden or a plastic bowl because otherwise the vinegar will react with anything metal so we're just going to put the rice now into this bowl and then using a rice spoon or a soft edged wooden spoon we just want to gently spread the rice across the bottom of our container and then we just want to take our sweet and vinegar and just pour it over the spoon not directly onto the rice just trickle it over the top of our sushi rice and then again using that soft edged spoon we're just going to turn the rice gently and it will slowly start to absorb the sweetened vinegar and by treating the rice very gently all the grains stay complete which just makes pretty sushi now that sweetened and seasoned vinegar has absorbed into the gluten that surrounds the rice now adding a wonderful flavor to this now we just want to evenly spread the rice across the bottom of our container and let it completely cool down and then we're ready to start making sushi now there's a wonderful little story that I've heard from Japanese chefs where these little bits of rice that are on the side of the bowl need to be pushed back down into the family otherwise they become dry and brittle and can ruin your sushi now if you know what that is comments down below and also it's a good idea just to cover the rice over with a damp cloth to stop it drying out there are a whole load of things you can put into sushi you can be as adventurous as you like I'm keeping it fairly simple one of my favorites a little bit of tuna with some Japanese Kewpie mayonnaise in there you can also use these crab sticks which are very popular with the California rolls carrots cut into little julienne matchsticks cucumber of course and the ever-present avocado and of course for our sushi we're going to want some nori sheets now I'm going to be using a full sheet of nori but you can make slightly smaller sushi if you want and you would do that by cutting a full sheet in half or actually folding it in half the best way I find is to fold the sheet of nori over one way and then fold it back on itself and that basically breaks the spine of the nori sheet and then you can very easily just pull that apart and you've got two halves of a nori sheet but as I say I'm going to use a full sheet for this recipe so now we've got all our ingredients together we can get on and make the sushi rolls I'm going to be using one of these bamboo rolling Metz and I've got my sheet of nori this is a shinier side toy but the shiny side down so I'm going to be taking about 250 grams 8 ounces of our sushi rice and spreading it on to our nori sheet and when you're handling the sushi rice your hands should be a little bit damp now I've got a bowl of water here just putting my hands into it to keep them damp not soaking wet but when you're handling the rice it won't stick if your hands are damp and as we push it across the nori sheet we want to leave about an inch at the end there so when we roll the nori up we have a nice clean edge to our sushi so you can see there the thickness that I've gone it's probably about half an inch thick with the sushi and I'm going to do this one we're just a regular crab stick so I take a couple of crab sticks and I'm also going to put some carrot in here you just evenly place the carrot along the sushi and I'm also going to put a few Julian's of cucumber on there as well and we've made sure that the edge of our nori is up against the bamboo like this and we're just going to lift it you can either lift it by hand and just pull the ingredients towards you and roll the sushi over like that now what will we're looking for is to bring if I can show you there bring the edge of our nori seaweed to meet the blank piece of nori that we left free and you want to compact and squeeze the sushi together and then what you can do is hold the bamboo mat like that and just firm up the sushi by pull it back towards you now what I like to do is just take a little bit of water and run it along the edge of that before we close the sushi up and then we can roll the sushi completely over and seal it like so now at this point if you wanted to make the sushi square you could actually squeeze the sushi into a square shape actually I'll make this one a little more square or you could leave it round and there we have it there is our sushi roll ready to slice now it's a good idea to have a good sharp knife and it's also a good idea to run water over it before you slice the sushi we have a little salvaged end here that is just going to cut off and then the rest of the sushi roll we want to cut about maybe three quarters of an inch just over a centimeter and there you have our beautiful little sushi rolls and we can just cut these all the way along occasionally we just want to dampen the knife so that is my sushi with the nori on the outside let me show you now how we're going to make sushi with the rice on the outside now when we're doing our inside-out sushi want to cover our bamboo mat in some cling wrap or plastic wrap like that it'll just stop the rice from sticking to it so for your inside-out sushi we're just going to take another full sheet of nori now you could do this with half sheets of course it would make a smaller sushi get our hands a little bit damp take a good handful of sushi rice actually a couple of handfuls and this time we're going to spread the rice all the way over the nori from edge to edge and when your sushi rice is spread across the nori and again that's about half an inch thick now these are black sesame seeds and they look wonderful but they also taste great when you see them on the outside of the sushi and you just want to sprinkle this over the top of the sushi rice now you can decide how much you like I like it quite thick I want to be able to taste it now if there is a tricky bit at all its lifting up your nori at the end and gently trusting you can flip your rice over the other way up and this time we're going to be putting our filling I'm going to be using advic our dough and tuna just an even distribution across the middle and now I'm taking that tuna which I mixed with a little Kewpie or Japanese mayonnaise and by the way I have a recipe for QP I might actually put that up very shortly on my channel so keep a lookout for that because this is a delicious and unusual mayonnaise and then we're going to roll our sushi over and we're just going to get it to there and pull it in tight continue to roll it over and we want to squeeze the sushi together fairly firmly as we roll and there you have it there is my inside-out sushi you can lift that off there now and again we want to take a sharp knife and just cut the salvage end off and again making sure the blade is wet so it doesn't stick to the rice we are just going to cut off our little sushis and don't they look absolutely fantastic they have it inside out and right way around sushi I hope you've enjoyed this one as I promised I'll also be showing you how to make homemade QP in the next few days I just need to get that video filmed and there is my sushi ready to serve it delicious I can't wait to try some of this I've got the inside out and the outside in I don't know if that's the right term maybe one of my Japanese viewers will give us the correct terminology down below it's been a heap of fun I hope you've learned something today I hope you've enjoyed the video please share the love give this one the thumbs up and look out I'll be doing the kewpie very shortly and I suppose I ought to really try one of these I always do well I'm going to take one of those half sheet nori wants to try not too big a mouthful well not for me anyway let's give this a go delicious that's absolutely fantastic you must try these at home and get the family involved as well it's a lot of fun see you next time thank you for joining me again I'm going to leave some links here to some of the other videos now I've had a little bit of run on Japanese food this week it's been a heap of fun I'd love to hear your comments down below please subscribe to the channel as always be good I'll see you in the next video

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Volcano Sushi Roll With Baked Seafood Dynamite on Top
content: I love sushi I love it so much and after years I've eaten it I decided to teach myself how to make it and now I want to teach you so please enjoy these video tutorials on how to make western-style sushi please rate and comment first we can start off with a half a sheet of nori in a palm full of sushi prepared rice and with wet hands gently press the rice to the edge of the seaweed and once you accomplish that flip over the piece of seaweed and we're going to first add the cream cheese just slice off a thin slice off the cream cheese and give it a little pinch to spread out to the end of the roll then I'm going to add a couple slices of some julienned cucumbers and then I'm going to add some crab sticks now this is a great base roll you can also use a California roll we just reposition the sushi on the mat here you want to get it towards the end now notice my fingers how I tuck in the filling and then squeeze it down and press it in and then roll it over to seal it that's real important to get that nice seal on the rolls next we're going to talk about the ingredients for the seafood dynamite has to be baked on top we're going to start off with the imitation crab sticks here are some base scallops that I steamed up in my bamboo steamer and here we have some salad shrimp once thawed you just give them a rough chop and then we have masago which is an option if you don't like masago don't use it I love it so I always use it in mind so first thing we're going to do is we're going to start off with the paper towel and press down on your crab sticks to get some of that extra moisture away from them and then you're going to want to cut them in half or you can cut them into thirds and you see you just break them up and they become very stringy almost like a spaghetti I'm just gently breaking apart the crab sticks and next I'm going to take the scallops the bay scallops lightly steamed up in my bamboo steamer and I just throw them in there frozen steamed them up and here are the salad shrimp that have been thawed and I give them a rough chop and here we have the seafood mixture you see everything's well combined next I add mayonnaise now it's up to you how much mayonnaise you like this is for several rolls so I did about three tablespoons and then a tablespoon hot sauce to start off with you can always add more and mix thoroughly to combine the ingredients and next you're going to add the masago I like to add it in this final step so I don't mix it up too much with it in there put a piece of plastic wrap down on to the seafood dynamite and put it in the fridge and let it set up for about 15 to 20 minutes and here we have a roll that's cut up I put it in a small tin lined with tin foil just I had a nice thin topping of the seafood dynamite to the roll you don't want too much but you definitely want a nice bite like I said you can change up your base roll beautiful thing about sushi you can always mix it up and change different things and here you see I just have a nice layer to finish this off I put this in my toaster oven bake it off on broil for about 10 minutes and here you have the end result this roll is you're going to win any beauty contests but taste contest that's a whole different story I hope you enjoy the volcano roll please rate and comment and enjoy the sushi

and not too thin if you lift up the blade like so then you dig deeper into a cucumber making the slices thicker now when you move the blade down like so you actually come more to the surface and you'll cut thinner slices the right thickness would be about a quarter centimeter is tenth of an inch once in a while just take the blade out of the cucumber wet it again so is you have more sauce some cake

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: Easy Sushi Recipe
content: hey guys this is Luke from kitchen expert at arrrg and today I am going to show you what I like to call my hillbilly sushi recipe I call it my hillbilly sushi recipe because it is the epitome of simpleness I am not using any special sushi rice I am not using sushi vinegar but I do use and I strongly encourage you to use also is the sushi nori which is the seaweed because that is what really gives the sushi its flavor start by adding three tablespoons of vinegar to half a cup of warm water then add two tablespoons of sugar and mix and while the rice is cooking I can go ahead and start trapping my vegetables I'm gonna cut the cucumber try not to use the seed part but if some of them get in there that doesn't matter don't be afraid to use big chunks about that thick go ahead and slice on red peppers as well if you have some green onions they taste great with the seaweed I also like to use a sweet omelet check out the blog post for more details on how to make that I will pour in my vinegar water mixture and mix in and then I will get my rolling match ready and now that everything else is ready I can finally bring out the fish I'm using Salman since sushi is made with raw fish make sure that the fish is fresh and you can start by laying down the rice I prefer using a fork to spread out the rice I found that it's better even than using your fingers and definitely better than using the spatula make sure to leave an area here that is not covered by rice because that will help to seal the roll once we get to that point start by putting on the fish the cucumber and finally the red bell peppers and then all I do is roll it up as tight as I can and I prefer my sushi square so I'm going to give it a slightly square shape and there we are once I have finished my rice and all the sushi rolls are done I'm going to begin cutting it the one advice I can give you here is to keep a bowl of water next to you and to keep wetting the knife as you cut make the first cut in the middle of the sushi then turn it and you can cut both sides at the same time and there you are perfectly stuffed very nice-looking sushi that you made in your home with hardly any effort and that I can promise you tastes as good as the stuff you'd buy in a restaurant maybe not a high-end restaurant but definitely in a restaurant enjoy

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to make Uni Sushi
content: to prepare the Unni nigiri the chef starts by cutting the nori sheet in the long strips these strips will wrap around the rice to give it a solid foundation he grabs some writes and forms it into a ball make sure your hands are slightly wet when you handle the rice the chef then places the clump of rice at the end of the strip of nori even wraps the seaweed around the rice until the clump is securely fastened this should leave a big enough slot for the Unni at the top watch again as he gracefully walks the nori strip around the rice and then overlaps to secure the nigiri is now ready to be topped with Dooney this is the California Gold uni it is the highest grade of Unni that we offer the texture is firm and the flavor is perfect the chef fits two pieces of duty on top of the rice the Unni should lay neatly slightly emerging from the nori this will finalize the Unni nigiri

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: California Sushi Roll Recipe Japanese Food - How to Make Sushi Ginger 2015
content: the California sushi roll is one of the most basic roles to make once you learn how to make this the possibilities are endless all you need to make California rolls is rice seasoned vinegar avocado crabmeat cucumber ginger wasabi roasted sesame seeds soy sauce water and your seaweed wrappers or nori first you're gonna rinse the rice in cold water until the water is completely clear and then go ahead and put the rice in the rice cooker so after your rice is cooked you're gonna transfer it to a big bowl and season it with seasoned vinegar 2 tablespoons and just drizzle it over the rice now using a flat spoon you're just gonna fold the rice into each other and then break up some of those big pieces so as you're folding in your rice you also want to span it a little to bring it to a little bit above room temperature now that your rice is done we're ready to make sushi rolls you're gonna need a bamboo mat these can be easily found at your grocery store or a restaurant supply store now grab a piece of your nori seaweed wrapper and put it shiny side down make sure you have a bowl of water close by to dip your fingers in so that the rice doesn't stick you're gonna need this now get a little bit of rice and lay it on your sushi wrapper and start with just a couple tablespoons you can always add more and slowly spread it out and you're going to want to leave about an inch at the very top so that you can seal your roll at the very end now we get to add all the yummy ingredients I'm gonna put two slices of avocado next we're going to use crab we're using imitation this is the most popular way to make a California roll all right and then a couple slices of these julienned hothouse cucumbers and then almost like you're stealing an envelope dip your finger into the water and use it to seal the top part of your roll this is gonna help the rolls stay together now when you're ready to roll your sushi roll you want to start by grabbing the end of the seaweed wrapper closest to and try to tuck all those ingredients in there but use your mat to do all the work so make sure you're tucking under the last ingredient use your mat to slowly roll and kind of walk your fingers back as you're rolling once it's all the way rolled kind of hold it give it a little hug make sure it's firm and there's your California roll now when you set aside put it seem side down and then this is gonna help firm it up before we cut them so now that you've learned how to make a basic sushi roll we're gonna step it up a notch and do it inside out roll so using the same bamboo mat I've just covered it with plastic wrap go ahead and grab your seaweed wrapper shiny side down and this time you're actually gonna put the rice all the way to the edge and then we're gonna sprinkle it with roasted sesame seeds this gives that roll just a little bit of crunch and makes it look good - very carefully you're gonna flip this over and then creamy avocado then your crab and then just a couple strips of the cucumber we're gonna seal the top again a little bit of water just like you're sealing an envelope and then you're gonna roll it the same way and then I actually like to sprinkle just a little bit more sesame seeds alright so now we're gonna cut the sushi rolls you want to make sure you have a really sharp knife and you want to make sure that you let the knife do the work for you sometimes it's good to run water over your knife to kind of help it so try to get right in the middle and then cut it right in half and then these two end pieces one more time and then these two and you want to face them up see how you can see that yummy crab the creamy avocado and the crunchy cucumber looks so good and with the inside-out rolls same technique there you have it the California sushi roll is delicious decadent and so fun to make I think this would be really fun to do a girls night in have a sushi making party thanks so much for watching I'm Brandi and I'll see you next time for another taste of young sugar TV

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: Sushi Rolls (Cucumber and Tuna Rolls) Recipe - Japanese Cooking 101
content: welcome to Japanese cooking 101 today we are making sushi rolls there are so many different types of sushi as you may know but today we are making a basic but popular sushi called hoso Maki sim rolls with one simple skinny filling the two most popular HOSA Maki our cake ìmake or tuna rolls and Kappa Maki cucumber rolls here are the ingredients we need some sushi rice roasted seaweed roe sashimi grade tuna and Japanese cucumber you can learn more about the ingredients and the complete recipe on our website Japanese cooking 101.com sushi rice can be made very easily by mixing steamed rice with seasoned rice vinegar please watch our sushi rice recipe video first if you have never made one before now we are going to cut the seaweed into half since we are making sim rolls we only need half the sheet per roll next we are going to cut the filling this is fresh sashimi grade tuna cut it into thin long pieces about half an inch thick or 1 centimeter and now we are cutting the cucumber the same way to trim the end and make thin long pieces the skin of the Japanese cucumber is not so thick so you don't need to peel it really if you can't get the Japanese kind you can substitute with other similar kinds like Persian or English cucumber remove the seeds and make it about half an inch or 1 centimeter thick now ready to roll we need a bamboo sushi mat just like this place half sheet of seaweed we just cut close to the front edge of the sushi mat place about a quarter cup sushi rice at room temperature on the seaweed and spread evenly leaving about one inch or two and a half centimeter space along the far edge of the seaweed place tuna strip right in the middle and holding the filling down a bit and roll with the mat from the front to the end tight squeeze here and roll it all the way just like making roll cakes and shape now let's make a cucumber roll place a cucumber strip right in the middle and while holding it down a bit roll it with the mat from the front to the end squeeze and roll all the way and shape remove the roll from the mat and cut it into eight pieces see the filling is right in the middle doesn't look bad at all serve with wasabi and soy sauce you may need a couple of times to practice the roll but you get the hang of it soon make these authentic Japanese sushi rolls for the parties and your friends and family will be very impressed Oh [Applause] [Music]

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Asparagus & Cucumber Sushi Rolls By Chef Pankaj
content: today we're gonna make an asparagus and cucumber sushi roll first take one cucumber and peel it then cut it into five to six thin slices now take 1/2 a cup of uncooked Japanese rice and mix it well with rice vinegar then take two stems of asparagus and slit it from the center downward now let's get cooking first take one newly sheet and cut it into two halves place one half on a wooden sushi mat Pat some Japanese rice on it and spread it evenly now turn it upside down and apply a heaped tablespoon of mayonnaise on the nori sheet add a few drops of wasabi and spread it evenly then place both the cucumber and asparagus on it and roll the wooden mat post molding the sushi sprinkle some black sesame seeds and there you go our sushi roll is ready to be eaten

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to make sushi sandwhiches
content: today's recipe is sushi sandwiches or or Nikki does it and sometimes be a bit daunting to make sushi at home but this sandwich version is dead easy in Japan recently they have been phenomenally popular it can sometimes be a bit hard to explain how to do this in words but once you see it done it is really simple it starts with just some nori seaweed and that's actually got two sides to it a shiny side and a rough side you want to put the shiny side down onto a piece of plastic wrap and if you've got a little bit of a water spray it can help the process you don't need to do this though then some rice normal sushi is made with short brown rice that's cooked and then seasoned with vinegar salt and sugar but for these you can actually just use regular short grain rice just want to wet my hands down to make things a bit easier put half the rice down you want to make a square shape but at 45 degrees to the shape of the nori you'll see why later now you can use any ingredients you like gonna make some with some prawn and avocado then maybe some teriyaki chicken and beans as well just lay that out on the rice trying to line up the ingredients on the diagonal of the seaweed [Music] the other half of the rice on top give it a bit of a pressed down and then just fold the corners in and then fold the plastic wrap to hold that all together I'm gonna leave these wrapped up like that for at least 10 minutes so the seaweed and the rice kind of stick together now we just unwrapped them cut them in half and those are the sushi sandwiches [Music]

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: FullyRaw Rainbow Sushi Rolls!
content: hey you guys it's Christina and today we are going to be making fully raw rainbow sushi rolls these are so colorful so nutritious so delicious and so much fun to eat these are raw vegan low-fat gluten-free and scrumdiddlyumptious seriously though eating these is like eating the rainbow this is all of nature's goodness wrapped up into one bite don't these look amazing for those of you who missed it I just announced my first fully raw book tour coming up within the next few months I'm so excited I'm going to be visiting cities nationwide and the list is still being updated so keep an eye out for some new cities popping up check out the video I shared a few days ago discussing event details and you can sign up on my website at pulley rod comback slash events and I will add that link below for you for this recipe you only really need a knife and a cutting board but if you have a blender or a food processor it will cut the prep time in half for you you will need some raw nori sheets and a sushi roller to help you roll out the sushi I am so excited to make this recipe with you they are so easy to make and share are you ready let's get started first thing is first chop up all of your rainbow ingredients that you want to use in your sushi there's no right or wrong here it's whatever you desire this recipe along with all of the ingredients in this video will be shared on my website at fully robbed comm for the rice of the sushi I'm going to be using a shredded or finely chopped jicama purple cauliflower and yellow cauliflower you can dice these with a knife or use a food processor to get the very fine grainy consistency then I have also chopped up some rainbow bell peppers beef cucumber carrot purple cabbage red onion mango and avocado to make your sushi grab a nori sheet and place it smooth side down grab some jicama sprinkle it on and press it onto your nori then do the same with your yellow cauliflower and your purple cauliflower when you have all three of these layered and press down onto your nori they will look like a tri-colored rainbow make sure to leave a little room around the edges of the nori for later now is the really fun part grab some cucumber and lay it on top add some bell peppers sprinkle on some shredded beets add some shredded carrots some purple cabbage red onion mango and avocado to top it off now this is going to be too much for one role or nori so what I do is I begin to wrap it up and tighten it with my sushi roller then I add another nori sheet on top and make it into one giant sushi roll by wetting the edges with some water then connecting them after this I roll up the whole thing using my sushi roller and form it into one giant sushi roll when your roll is fully tight grab at the sharpest knife you can find and start slicing out your rolls about an inch at a time and then start placing these onto a plate how awesome do these look when ready put these to the side and now let's make our sesame ginger lemon dressing in your Vitamix add a half a cup of raw nama shoyu three to four tablespoons of raw unhold sesame seeds 1 small thumb of ginger and a squirt of fresh lemon juice blend this up until it title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: Using Avocado on Top of Sushi: How to Make a Caterpillar Roll
content: hey guys my name is Brian skinny from secrets of sushi comm and in this video I'm going to show you guys how to make the caterpillar roll the caterpillar roll is a fairly common sushi roll found on sushi restaurants all across the United States it's pretty iconic because it has thinly sliced avocado that's kind of formed around the top of the roll and they usually do like a really neat plate presentation where it actually looks like a caterpillar on your plate now normally this roll is made with unagi on the inside and cucumber but seeing as how freshwater eel is not only endangered species list in two different countries and probably soon-to-be many more countries for this tutorial I'm actually going to be using tempura fried shrimp instead of unagi the tempura fried shrimp are going to be more sustainably sourced and more economic for your wallet than freshwater eels going to be so let's get started for this tutorial I have just a few pieces of cut cucumber and avocado a few pieces of tempura fried shrimp my bowl of sushi rice a small bottle of eel sauce and my cellophane wrapped in Maki soon I've also got a few half cut sheets of nori and my bowl of water first thing I want to do is get our half cut sheet of nori and lay it horizontally across our Maki sir I'm going to make sure that the rough textured side is facing up and the smooth side is facing down when I get your hands slightly wet so a nice and glossy but not quite dripping with water and we're gonna get a handful of rice and we want to slowly spread that rice to all four edges you want to make sure that the rice is about two to three grains deep and that you can still see a little bit of the nori peeking out from underneath the rice intermittently so after our rice is spread across our half cut sheet of nori you want to grab the two corners we gently flip it over and then we want to do is set all of our ingredients along the centerline of the nori so the first thing I'm going to do is grab a few pieces of cucumber and then a few pieces of our tempura shrimp and as you can see our temperature imp doesn't quite go all the way to the edges so what I'm going to do is take the shrimp and slice it diagonally go ahead and do that for each one and we can set them back along the centerline and just slightly stagger them a little bit and what this will do is it's going to stretch out that shrimp make sure they'll meet from end to end and also make it a little bit more consistent along the center of the ruler now since we only have the two ingredients for the inside of this roll let me go ahead and roll it up so you want to put your thumbs underneath the Maki soo and you want to use your remaining fingers on the other side of the ingredients to kind of hold it in place we're going to gently roll the edge of our rice mat that's closest to us over the top of the ingredients and keep rolling it until it meets the exposed part of the nori now at this point we're going to drape the democracy back over and we're going to give the role a gentle squeeze making sure that we're not squeezing down but in fact squeezing back towards us it's going to give a gentle squeeze back towards us and what this is going to do is compress all of those ingredients together making sure there's not a lot of air inside and also making sure this edge of the nori is tucked in instead of being squished out so afterwards we can just finish the rowing process out by giving one more roll over and another gentle squeeze this time pressing a little bit more down and then we have it now what I like to do is do a quick roll tightening technique where I hold on to the bottom of the Maki see with my left hand drape the maka see over the roll with my right hand and spread my fingers up out and then just apply some downward pressure and roll that back towards me just like that now we're going to get to the fun part of thinly slicing that avocado to drink over the top of our roll so what you want to do is carefully slice your avocado in half and you can twist the two halves to open up your avocado and then I want you guys to hand peel your avocado all right now we're going to try to slice this avocado as thinly as possible so once you guys to do is make a posh ape with your hand and I want you to set the wrist on the cutting board and gently drape your fingers over the avocado and you're going to actually let the your finger touch the knife as you're dragging the knife across the cutting board we're going to do is trying to make a couple of thin slices and we want to continue to do this until I've cut the entire oven kado now that avocado is nice and thinly sliced but once you guys to do is take one hand and gently push the avocado from one side we're going to kind of stagger these pieces out and what our goal here is to try to make sure that the avocado is about the same length as the roll itself now to transfer the avocado to the roll I always take my knife and very carefully slide it underneath the avocado and use the knife itself to pick it up and then I'm going to set the knife on top of my roll and gently put my hand on top of the avocado and then just slowly hold the knife out from underneath making sure the avocado balances on top of the roll next we're going to get a piece of cellophane film and drape it over the top make sure that your piece of cellophane is wide enough that whenever you slice the roll the edges of the cellophane are going to be far enough away so that you won't actually cut through it this will make it a lot easier to peel this little thing off once the rolls been cut into individual pieces then we're going to get a Maki soon preferably one that isn't wrapped in cellophane because the one that is wrapped in cellophane is going to pull this piece of cellophane up off of it we're going to take this unwrapped Maki soup and use the flat side of the bamboo pieces and drape that over the top of the roll and we're just going to gently press down very very gently to make sure that the avocado is wrapping around the roll just like that I should have a con does not hang off the end is too much and now we're going to slice the roll using a wet rag go ahead and get your knife slightly wet we're going to start in the center of the roll using long slicing motions and really letting the weight of the knife carry it from the top of the roll down to the cutting board and cut that roll in half cut those halves into quarters and then cut those quarters into eighths all right and as you can see the piece of cellophane is end up looking pretty gnarly when we're done I'm just going to slowly peel that off make sure you get all the pieces of cellophane off of there and you can take your wrap Maki soon place it over the top again just give it a gentle squeeze so put everything back in the same shape it was before we cut the roll now one of the more iconic parts about the caterpillar roll is how it looks on the plate so I want to show you guys real quick the plating technique that most chefs use to make it actually look like it's a caterpillar crawling on plate I like to use relatively large rectangular plates and nice and flat and what I do is get my hands just ever so slightly wet I'm going to take four pieces or half the roll and I'm going to kind of curve them just a little bit it's almost like you're trying to make a fourth of a circle or maybe a third of a circle I'm going to pick those four pieces up place them onto a plate and you're going to take the other four pieces and curve them in the opposite direction then you can pick up those pieces up and also set on the plate and kind of play around with the spacing a little bit until you find a curve that you particularly like and then finally we're going to get a bottle of eel sauce we're just going to drizzle it right over the top and finally we're going to finish off our caterpillar roll with a little bit of toasted sesame seeds thank you guys so much for watching this video if you have any questions about how to make the caterpillar roll feel free to drop me a line in the comments section below and for more information on how to make sushi at home visit my website secrets of sushi comm which you can find a link in the description box below my name is brian skinny from secrets of sushi comm and that's how I roll

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make California Roll 【Sushi Chef Eye View】
content: California roll is one of the most popular and famous sushiro among the western-style sushi menu there are various opinions but it is that California roll was first created in 1963 at the sushi bar in Los Angeles because most Americans at that time were not familiar with Roe fish as in traditional sushi and also they scared of blood color and texture of seaweed one of the sushi chef made an insider roll with avocado and crabmeat which was named California roll and spread out throughout the u.s. in the 1980s following California roll as a pioneer of inside-out roll there are now hundreds of different kinds of rows in each sushi chef tries their creativity trying to start making California roll prepare the tools and ingredients you can get a bamboo sushi mat at an Asian supermarket or you might find one in a dollar shop see the ingredients listed here break down a pack of imitation crab meat and mix with mayonnaise you need a piece of seaweed sheet nowadays not only the Asian markets regular supermarkets also have some selections usually they sell a whole nori sheet which measures about 8 by 7 and half inch so you need to cut in half horizontally to prepare for inside-out roll prepare sushi rice the best timing to use it is about one hour after it's cooked it is thoroughly steamed but not too hot nor too it around that the body temperature is the best pick up the rice about 150 gram and place it on the upper left of the seaweed make the rice roughly around the shape to make it easy to spread it out using just your finger tip spread the rice from the left to the right using a gentle pinching motion then spread them upward and downward it is important not to slash or compress the rice as you want it stay fluffy create an even layer of rice to cover the entire sheet place cucumber avocado and crop salad along the center of the seaweed pick up the edge of the seaweed to cover the whole ingredient and tighten up little bit push forward to stick the rice to the rest of the seaweed to close the roll be careful not to squeeze the road too hard otherwise the ingredients won't come out from the side cover the roll with plastic wrap and place the bamboo mat on top of it shape the roll for the better trapezoid shape slightly lifts up rather than push it down now cutting pieces for serving prepare a nicely shopping life make the knife little wet with water in order to prevent the rice from sticking on the blade using a sewing motion cut the row in one bite size

title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How to Make Vegetable Sushi at Home
content: hi there Pamela sulfon from the kitchen matters vlog and today I'd like to show you how to make vegetable sushi it can be done at home so I'm gonna start with some sushi rice I'm gonna make it from scratch you need a sticky rice for this to work otherwise the rice will just kind of fall apart in the roll so a sushi rice labeled like this is great if you insist on doing something with brown rice you can use a short grain brown rice combined with a sweet brown rice and the sweet rice will have more starch and it will make everything nice and sticky so you can also go to your local sushi place and just buy the rice from them and then make what you want at home the important thing is to rinse the rice first so I'm using a fine mesh sieve which has very very small holes just enough for the water to permeate but not enough for the rice to go through like a colander would and you just want the water to run clear once you you know have rinsed the rice so you can still see it's a bit cloudy I usually do this for about 30 seconds or so and just drain it a little bit gonna shake some of that excess water out and then I'm going to put it into this is about one and a half quarts this pot it's just a cup of rice so we don't need anything bigger than this and I'm gonna add to this one and a quarter cups of water just follow the package directions most of them say between one and a quarter cups and one and a half cups of water but you're not gonna use the same 1 to 2 cup ratio that you normally would with rice so just keep that in mind so I'm gonna add 1 and a quarter cup of water I'm gonna bring this to a boil over high heat I'm gonna lower it all the way down to low keep it covered and I'm gonna cook this for 15 minutes and then it'll be ready to go okay the sushi rice is done now I checked on it after 15 minutes and the water was absorbed I like to let it sit for a few minutes but what I'm gonna do now is take some rice vinegar that I had mixed with a little bit of sugar and a little bit of salt and I warmed up the vinegar so that the sugar and the salt would dissolve if you put it into cold vinegar and you just whisk it it's not gonna dissolve well you could also use something like agave I'm not a big you know fan of it but for a couple of teaspoons or something it's not really a big deal and that is already you know in liquid form so you wouldn't have to warm up your vinegar so we're gonna pour this over our rice and we're just gonna stir it in okay make it all nice and well incorporated and then I'm gonna pour this into a bowl and just keep stirring it just to cool it down a little bit as well and I'm gonna use this rice then to make our sushi so I'm gonna do some veggie sushi today but you can really do whatever you want if you can find good quality fish or you can even do something like smoked salmon or cook salmon or cook shrimp it's the same technique so you can really you know do whatever you want you can also do things that are more fun like do roasted sweet potato slices in here or some sprouts or you know who knows what anything goes really okay so I'm gonna just set this off to the side and I'm gonna prep my vegetables for the sushi and I have some really beautiful Reed avocados today these are amazing they're in season right now they're not in season for very long but I'm gonna use these because I think that the flesh is really nice and creamy and I love the flavor and I'm gonna use some cucumber so these are my son's favorite for sushi so I'm gonna use these today you can julienne things or you can cut them into like logs whichever you want but I just wanted to show you my setup over here because you want to be pretty organized before you get started so I have some roasted nori so you want to look for roasted sheets of nori like this and I got this just at a kitchen supply store by me but Whole Foods has that you can order them online but they're not difficult to find so I'm using this one and I also have a bowl with water in it and that's for my hands so that my hands don't stick to the rice once I put it in my hands and then I have a towel just to get my hands clean and I like to sprinkle the rice with something called gomathy oh and this is a Japanese macrobiotic condiment it's sesame seeds and sea salt I just think it gives it really good flavor this one happens to also have seaweed in it my kids love it I sprinkle it on top of like green bowls all the time but we happen to really like it in sushi too so I'll do a little sprinkle of this as well okay so let's prep our vegetables with the cucumber I just want to get it so that it's the same size as our sheets of nori so I think I'll cut it right about here and just trim the end and I like to do these kind of strips but again if you wanted to julienne it that's cool too so just like that so I'll show you how to do small sushi rolls that are cut and then I'll show you how to do the big rolls which are a lot easier okay I also have here which you kind of need to do the small rolls and this is just a bamboo mat they're very inexpensive they're like a dollar you can find them online I've even seen them in some supermarkets and obviously at like a Japanese grocery store you can find them but they're really inexpensive I always put a ziplock bag over it just to keep the mat from getting like rice inside of it and then I can just you know either wash the plastic or I can just you know use a different one all right so here's um one sheet of nori and this is going to be for a big roll okay if I'm doing small rolls I'm gonna have to cut the nori so let's first start by dipping my fingers into the water and then grab some rice still a tad warm fact I'll try and cool it off a little bit more like this now you don't want to cover the nori with like a thick layer of rice okay you could actually you're better off if you have if you can see some of the nori underneath as opposed to you know massive whiteout here because it'll be more difficult to roll if you have too much rice so less is better truthfully all right looks good wet my fingertips spread the rice around like that and you want to have a border at the base not on the edges so much but at the base you want to have a border so that you can roll it but you know do go all the way to the ends so you can see I'm not covering every little square centimeter of the nori there that looks good okay so then I like to sprinkle you don't have to do this if you don't want to but you know again we like it sprinkle it with a little of that and then I'm gonna do some cucumber and then let's cut some avocado I like to wait till the last minute to cut the avocado because I don't want it to get brown and we'll put a couple of pieces of avocado in here and this is for what I like I said a big roll so it's cut a little edge of this hmm this is a gorgeous avocado look at that I mean does that just make your day or what makes my day okay so let's cut this into like some strips just like that beautiful and we'll just put a little wedge right there and I'm gonna try and sneak this little guy in here too okay all right now we're gonna roll it up so you don't really need the mat for the big roll so you're just gonna kind of fold over towards the midline and then kind of tuck in the nori and then just keep rolling tuck and roll tuck and roll and you see why you need some space there because sometimes the rice gets pushed a little and then the moisture from the rice should help to close the nori and seal it if you're having a hard time you can just wet your fingertips and run it across the nori that isn't covered with rice and then you know it should seal but this is sealing fine so here's your big roll I like to dip the knife in just a tiny little bit let the water run down a bit and then you can cut this into pieces so you want to saw not smush and it's good to have a sharp knife to do this okay look at that we just need sushi how about that so good huh so this is great for a lunchbox I don't make it too much anymore because I don't have that much time in the morning but you could make them the night before I don't love the rice refrigerated overnight but these are so fun to bring to a party or if you have kids over appetizers like super fun okay so I'd like to now show you how to do a smaller role because there is a bit of a different technique with that one okay so you're gonna take your sheet of nori fold it in half or you can use a scissor fold it the opposite direction so you get a nice perfect break and we're gonna do the same thing right not all the way just enough and you can't put too much filling so you kind of have to decide rice and cucumber or rice and avocado unless you have everything really really thin and small all right that looks good wait my hand just important that two little towel is because the rice drives me crazy and let's just put one strip of cucumber right there a little gum Osseo voila and take your mat to help you okay so it will help you curl over and then once you've got it curled over then you can sort of like tuck it a little bit okay and then crimp it like that just go right in don't be afraid and then keep rolling okay and that's how you do a small one you really need the mat and then you can just cut this like you do the other ones okay so and then you got the little baby's so cute okay that's how you roll sushi
