title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: How To: Step-by-Step Sushi at Home
content: [Music] all sushi starts with rice but not all rice is the same varieties include brown rice jasmine wild rice our borio rice mochi or glutinous rice and for sushi medium or short grain sushi rice we've cooked Japanese sushi rice according to the instructions on the bag following the manufacturer's instructions on our rice cooker if you don't have a special sushi bowl you can use a large shallow dish like this as long as there is a large surface area for stirring and cooling the rice first drizzle a little seasoned rice vinegar also called sushi vinegar over the rice then use a rice paddle or spatula to break up the rice by gently cutting through it and folding it over itself fan the rice to cool it before adding more vinegar repeat the process adding more vinegar and gently turning and folding the rice until all the vinegar is added and the rice is cooled to room temperature the idea is to gently break up any lumps of rice so each grain absorbs the vinegar without smashing or breaking the grains when it's cool cover the bowl with a damp towel to prevent it from drying out but don't refrigerate sushi rice get the other ingredients together including sheets of nori for the filling we've chosen daikon sprouts pickled daikon pickled burdock root and fresh cucumber start by setting a sushi mat in front of you toasted nori has a shiny side and a dull side set a sheet of nori shiny side down with the longer side parallel to the slats of the mat to keep the sushi rice from sticking to your fingers dip your hands in water gently clap your hands to remove excess water then gather about a cup of rice form it into a rough log shape and set it on the nori using your fingers gently push the rice to cover the nori evenly taking it 2/3 of the edges and leaving the closing edge with a margin of about an inch if your fingers get too sticky dip them in water again line up the filling ingredients across the middle of the rice don't use too much filling and space the ingredients evenly to ensure a tight uniform roll using the mat as a support lift the edge up and over the filling use your fingers to tuck the filling in place as you roll now tuck the mat tightly into a roll so that only the nori without any rice is exposed pull back to tighten the roll reposition the mat and roll tightly with the sushi roll on the work surface use the mat to gently squeeze and shape the roll slice the sushi wiping the knife after each cut with a wet towel to keep the blade from getting too sticky cut the roll in half then cut each half into three segments arrange the sushi on a plate garnished with pickled ginger and wasabi to make a California roll set a sushi mat wrapped with plastic wrap in front of you then arrange the nori shiny side up with the longer side parallel to the slats of the mat gently spread about a cup of rice over the surface sprinkle toasted sesame seeds evenly over the rice we've used both white and black sesame seeds carefully flip the nori sheet don't worry the rice will stick to the nori and because of the plastic wrap it won't stick to the mat now arrange the filling in a strip across the center of the rice avocado lift the edge of the mat up and over the filling tucking the filling in with your fingers as you roll tuck and roll the mat tightly into a roll so that only the nori without any rice is exposed with a sushi roll on the work surface use the mat to gently squeeze and shape the roll slice the sushi wiping the knife after each cut with a wet towel to keep it from getting sticky cut the roll in half then cut each half into three segments arrange the sushi on a plate garnished with pickled ginger and wasabi and served with Kikkoman soy sauce [Music]

content: hi i'm rachael ray and on today's show i'm going to show you how to make candy sushi alright so here's what you're going to need what you're going to need is a box of six fruit by the foot a box of Willy Wonka nerves an egg hearty glassful with marshmallow eggs this is what the bag looks like you're going to need a cup of creamy supreme vanilla frosting and you're also going to need a bag of sour gummy worms preferably market ranch whatever this is from target and don't get fruit roll-ups stackers because those aren't what we want it looks like this you're not going to get anywhere title: How to Make a Sushi Roll
original_title: Easy Sushi Roll Recipe - Krab and Cucumber
content: hi this is sushi mark kirimaya sushi daddy.com I love sushi I love it so much and after years of eating it I decided to teach myself how to make it and now I want to teach you so please enjoy these video tutorials on how to make american-style sushi please write in comment and enjoy the sushi start off here we have the fish cakes or the imitation crab sticks the julienne slices of cucumber cream cheese and then of course masago to go on top of the roll we're gonna start off with a half a sheet of toasted nori seaweed and then a palm full of so she prepared rice and with what hands gently press that out to the edge of the seaweed next we're gonna put that on her sushi mat now I cover mine with a freezer bag a gallon size freezer bag it helps prevent anything to stick into the mat and the first thing I always add is the cream cheese so I can build around that then I add the fish cakes or the crab sticks and then the julienne slices of a cucumber put about two in here no one overfill the roll cuz it makes it harder to seal in in the end and it can become quite messy so I hold the filling down with my fingers and then roll it over almost halfway push it down the filling roll it over again to seal it and then I'm just gonna press it one more time I'm gently pressing it and this is just a format up they get the nice circular shape and we're gonna top this role with masago I love the taste the masago brings in the color it just makes it very vibrant if you're not a fan of moussaka you can top with toasted sesame seeds you can top with avocado slices instead or you could even do like a smoked salmon and layer that and I would still do the same process I do here and we'll just finish putting a nice even layer of masago on top of the roll it's a little messy but it's worth it and next I'm gonna take a piece of cellophane wrap and cover the roll and just press down the masago on top I have find this really helps when you dunk it into soy sauce you don't lose a big old clump of masago in the soy sauce now to cut this world I'm gonna use a wet serrated knife I'm gonna cut the roll in half cut those halves in half again and half those halves I know it sounds like a lot of Hafs but at the end you have 8 equal pieces of the cream cheese crab stick roll I hope you enjoyed this video tutorial on how to make American style sushi please rate and comment and enjoy the sushi the more recipes and position supplies you can visit me online at my sushi daddy.com
